Rocket League is an excellent game and one of my favourites. It's very easy to understand but hard to master.  Optimisation is great, and graphics also is fantastic. The game also has full controller support, but you can play with mouse and keyboard as well, so it's up to you how you want to play. I more prefer the controller.  After the first launch of the game, you will hear a fantastic music on the menu. After that, you can choose your car. Play tutorial, and finally, you will be able to play your first game on multiplayer.  In the game, there are a lot of cars, and you can also buy paid DLC's. Cars from DLC's are technically the same. The only differences are hit boxes. According to developers, all of the cars have the same stats. Vehicles are customisable. For example, you can add an antenna, change your wheels, colour of the car, etc.  Like I wrote above Rocket League is very easy to understand because, in the main mode, the game consists of control the giant ball and try to score. To put it simply, it's just football with cars. You can choose between 1vs1, 2vs2, 3vs3, and 4vs4. The main modes are playable on casual and competitive types of the game. But there are also game modes which are more advanced like for example ice hockey, basketball and my personal favourite 'RUMBLE'. In 'RUMBLE' rules are the same, but here, every ten seconds the game draws for you one special ability. For example grappling hook, a tornado and a freezer weapon.  As I mentioned above, here are competitive matches. After ten games, you will get your rank. There are ranks like PROSPECT (I, II, III, Elite) CHALLENGER (I, II, III, Elite), RISING STAR, ALL-STAR, SUPERSTAR, CHAMPION.  The game rewards us in the form of points for all sorts of tricks, like aerials, bicycle hits, etcetera.   The Verdict Rocket League is a unique game with simple rules. If you haven't bought this game, do it. You will not regret. My final rating is 10/10.    If you found any mistakes, something isn't right, or you just don't like this review. Instead of giving me a thumbs down, tell me what is wrong. Thank you.

Amazing game.  This game is so dynamic and energetic, not a second is spent bored. Non stop action with your team, always edging to get the game deciding nudge, whether it be defense or attack. You spend hours, upon hours, getting addicted and mastering your skills.   This game will make it to the massive multiplayer leagues. Rocket League will improve once they get proper class ranks, gained through playing ranked matches.   Rocket League also features in depth customisation, allowing the user to ultimately customise their vehicle. This allows uniqueness, and a great ton of laughter.  Graphics of this game is amazing. If your computer isn't the best then you'll have to turn down the graphics a little, but your PC doesn't need to be expensive to play the game on great graphics. Decent laptops can even play this game decently.  This game is honestly a 9/10. Rocket League has the graphics, the dynamic energetic gameplay, the competitive experience in multiplayer and more.

ABOUT THE GAME :  Rocket League is a Soccer inspired sports game made by Psyonix. In this game you use a car to hit around a large ball into a goal, pretty much Soccer with cars.  It might be the best game I've played this year so far.  PRO : - Great gameplay. - Very competitive. - Matchmaking. - Easy to pick up and a hard way to master. - Marvelous graphics. - Tons of customization. - Cool DLC's. - Cross-platform. - Save replays after matches and edit them to your hearts content in the editor.   CON : - You can unlock a lot of things in such a small time.   Conclusion: Rocket League is an amazing game! I highly recommend it ~ 10/10

What I thought was the worst concept EVER (really? Football and Cars together? Come on.. anyone?) ended up being one of the most addictive games I’ve come to cross around.  PROS -Everyone is on the same page. There is no difference in XP, Cars, Skins or anything. SKILLS are everything -Very fluid -No bugs (at least I haven’t found one) -Multi-Platform -Coop and Local Coop  CONS -NO OFFLINE LAN. That kind of sucks… really. This would be a reason to NOT RECOMMEND a good game, but this game is pretty great, so I still give it a recommend (Oh yeah, I wan’t to hear those brats from US and EU talk about how everyone got internet now and we don’t need LAN Anymore, and this is a stupid complain.. please go ahead)  -Servers give a connection problem all the time. I asked a lot of people, and I am getting the same answer from at least 40% of the people. Maybe is just here in South America, and playing with servers outside the ping goes over 200. The good thing is that the game does not become totally unplayable, especially for new, not all that skilled players (like myself :D) -No the best Match Making system ever, but this is not a Con per say… just not so great yet I think  But really. Awesome game. Worth the full price. Tell your friends and Rocket!

Psyonix's magnum opus, Rocket League, is one of the most fun games I've had the joy to play. The master of fast-paced, addictive gameplay, the 5 minute matches keep you playing into the early hours of the morning and never failing to keep the action above 60mph! The vertical flexability that the openness of a Rocket League pitch offers is incredible, boasting a  Cirque de liberté  for you to perform all sorts of zany twists and turns in mid-air, it's remarkable to see glorious goals and superb saves made by some of the insanely talented players. One can better their Rocket League play naturally, by simply enjoying the game, however, the more difficult tricks like; airials, freestyles, dribbling and perfect positioning take some serious skill and precision and are a sight to see in competitive play. The game's perfectly playable with either a controller or mouse 'n' keyboard, so it's up to you to decide how you play. The customisation is great, fine-tuning your Rocket-Powered Battle-Car is fantastic and the options are near endless, offering plenty of choice. However, there is microtransactions. But, these are implemented in one of the best ways I've seen in any game, they're not intrusive or necessary for victory AT ALL, they're simply cosmetic. The free Rumble gamemode is serious fun and it's nice to see the devs frequently adding new features and stadiums to one of the most fun games of 2015. I don't care too much for either cars or football, but I adore Rocket League. Totally worth its full price and it's a steal on sale, highly recommended.

TL;DR   ---------  Its addictive and my most played game to date. Please buy it in or out of a sale :)  So, I was going to write a review at 100 hours but another 100 later and its... Been a few days... What can I say, the game is worth it at full price PLUS DLC (I have most DLC -- 3 are needed to 100% achievements). This game is very easy to pick up and there are tons of skills to master the game -- from dribbling to advanced aerials -- if you want to play it competitively or just improve. Plus there are tons more to come with Rocket Labs introduced and there is a basketball mode in the making as I write this review :)  ---------  Pros --     Great customization with base game and/or with DLC. You can customize paint, wheels, car body, the boost, hats etc!    Great common and uncommon drops    Gameplay is steady, you can easily play with keyboard and mouse or controller (I personally use an Xbox One controller)    Love the soundtrack     Achievements are easy but maybe a little bit of a grind for some     The UI is clean and well set out -- there is even a nice quick chat feature (Nice shot, Centering, Defending etc)    You can save replays to watch later or upload to youtube    It's so much fun to play alone in 1v1, matchmaking in 2v2/3v3/4v4 or with friends    Community is mostly friendly, you can now report... the rest...     The devs are great, they are constantly changing the game with a new ranked system and maps etc!     Great training modes and multiple levels of difficulty of AI to practice offline or before/in between a match   Well... You get the point with the pros...  Cons     Achievements and little content in the DLC does not feel worth it but forces you to buy if you want to 100% the game... DLC isn't needed so not a big deal. But hey... Batmobile DLC... GET IT!     I have had maybe 2 crashes and a few bad connections in my time, but it reconnects you to the match you were in so you don't lose XP    Conclusion... Buy the game. Its awesome. I've had a blast and there will be many more hours of fun to come! The game will only get better from here! Whoops... Nice shot! 10/10 <3

Soccer with Cars!  PROS:  >A wonderfully made sequel to Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket Powered Battle Cars with much better graphics, mechanics, and new content  >Psyonix took a very simple idea and made something wonderful with it. Rocket League truly is the easy to learn - hard to master game that the more you play the better you become  >Rocket League is constantly watched by its developers who update the game periodically and always deliver new free and DLC content (All DLC for this game is only cosmetic which delivers a much better experience for those who want more and doesn't effect those who don't decide to pick up the DLC)  >Rocket League provides a competitive and casual playlist for those who wish to either play for #1 on the leaderboards or jump into a few matches here and there   >Unlike other sports games where you press a button to do an action, in Rocket League you actually have to learn moves and tricks. You control the direction of your car and how you play each and every match   CONS:  >At times I find competitive matchmaking to be off to where you get matched with players way below your skill level and sometime players way above your skill level  >Although Rocket League provides a fun and awesome experience, you don't get the full experience playing alone. I suggest picking up Rocket League with a couple of friends to make it more interesting   FINAL VERDICT:  If you do get the chance to pickup Rocket League with a few friends I suggest you do so. For 20 dollars you can't go wrong for the amount of hours you an your friends will pour into Rocket League

Simple competitive fun with lots more.   I've become old and boring and haven't truly enjoyed playing games with strangers for nearly a decade. I just don't like being on other people's time and sitting in lobbies. I'd rather play singleplayer these days. But Rocket League brought me back into the fold. You're rarely waiting on other people. You can drop in to most modes within seconds and games are merely five minutes of clock time and pauses for goals. Its simple, quick, doesn't waste your time. I enjoy that. Not to mention the game itself is fun fun fun! And there is a subpar singleplayer even.   I was indoctrinated with the standard 'soccer' modes of 3v3 but as I plateau'd and didn't develop into a competitive player I branched out into the less popular modes and matchups. There's plenty here to keep people of all skill levels, shapes, and sizes happy. E-Sports level competitiveness with the ability to join with your friends right down to what I'm doing casually bouncing into 2 or 3 'Rumble' matches with strangers when I got the time. Rocket League did something else for me too. The PC has a barren desert in the sports genre and this mildly and subtly fills the void a little more.  They're also consistently adding new free content and updates. All the while keeping paid DLC cosmetic. I could care less about all the knick-knacks as I don't even decorate my car but its got all that item customization people like. Wheels, paints, decals, toppers(hats), etc. They even added a crate system for those so inclined. Full price might be a little steep now that they do indeed have all these other avenues of revenue but that's what sales are for and I'd recommend waiting for one. Recommended!

Absolutely amazing game. I really didn't expect this much fun when I first got it, but holy damn. I've never had this much instant fun in a game in a loooong time. I also don't think I've had this much adrenaline while playing a game ever.   Absolutely amazing game design. Its extremely juicy; there are great effects and small touches that really, really add to the fun of the game. Everything you do feels satisfying and extremely responsive. Controls are very intuitive as well if you use a controller, such as Xbox or PS.  So deceptively simple, yet so insanely fun. Not much depth on the outside, but once you play you realize that there is a lot of depth, and a LOT of potential.  Easy to play, hard to master.  Buy this game. Now.

The game is easy to pickup and easy to learn but diffenetly something you should play with friends, the sheer joy of in fact lining up that perfect goal or getting it is a great feeling of something silly and stupid that will make you scream the ears of all your friends and wake up whoever else lives in the house. Okay you want a review? let me tell you how I feel about this game and why I gave it a down-vote. so you might be thinking 'wow this guy has so many hours in this game, why would he down-vote this game?' well the game itself is fine. let me break it down for you.  9.5/10 game. 1/10 community. 2/10 ranking system.  Back when this game first came out I would 10/10 recommend this game. nobody really knew what they were doing and it was just as much of a party game as mario kart or gang beasts, etc etc. it was a blast and super hilarious... then people starting getting good. eh no biggy. we're still just as silly but now we actually see ourselves getting better. as time goes on the community gets more and more competitive. now its at a point where if you buy this game and you're playing it for the first time, you probably will just get frustrated that you are so bad compared to everyone else and corrupted by the mindset of the community. its about like csgo. but if you have the patience to fight through that and find the good people, go for it.  the next thing i want to address is the poorly designed ranking system. its OK, but could be A LOT better. now i don't want to complain but if you want your players to take your game seriously in a competitive scene, its only fair to them to give them a fair chance. so let's say you queue up for a match, and you're like lvl 20 ish level, rank prospect 2 in the new season. the problem is, the ranking match ups are all over the place. its like, win 4 matches in a row 'oh man you must be a god at this game, lemme just go ahead and match you against people 5 ranks above you' then you get your ♥♥♥ handed to you twice and you're back down to people 2 ranks less than you etc etc cycle goes on and on. and besides, you shouldn't even be getting matched against these people in the first place.   I was all-star level last season, i've played this game since launch and have had a ton of fun. but i have so many issues with this game as far as ranked and community goes. but the game itself is fine.   SO TL:DR... don't get this game unless A you're willing to work very hard to get good because god forbid you ever just play for fun, or B, you have good friends to have good times with in the game. i'm telling you, its toxic. don't go in there. also the AI is trash. k bye.

The proof that a game doesn't need to be mechanically complex to be compelling. Rocket Leauge is as simple as video games get. But it's tweaked and polished to perfection, making every moment all kill and no fill. And when the game is at it's best moments, whether it be the tense stand offs when all the players rush for the ball at kickoff or 30 seconds left on the clock with a tied scoreboard. It can be genuinely hard to put down. It harks back to simpler times, when video games didn’t need a billion bells and whistles to keep players interested. They just needed great design, and that’s exactly what you get with Rocket League. Soccer with cars. And it's beautiful.

Let's get it out of the way: this may be the single best multiplayer game of recent years. Why, you may ask?  It's a simple enough concept but executed almost perfectly and then honed and polished to a shine. It's the very idea of 'easy to learn, hard to master'. The controls are intuitive and the mechanics so straightforward that you'll grasp them within minutes. And yet it will probably take you hundreds of hours to master all the intricacies of its systems. While beginner level games take place mostly on the ground, high level play gains a whole other vertical dimension and pro games are a spectacle to behold. And the best thing: it's a fun experience all along the way!  Psyonix also made a couple of sound decisions during its development: cross-platform play guarantees a large playerbase for the years to come, unlocked, dropped and bought items (there is a 'key & crate' system in place) are cosmetic in nature only (no stat boosting) and the DLC cars handle the same (except turn radius) as every other car in the game and only differ in their hitbox. The camera settings are also completely customizable (FOV up to 110) to accommodate a wide range of playstyles.  Be aware that due to the nature of the game, competitive game modes can be a salt mine of gigantic proportions. Fortunately enough, Psyonix provide different filter settings for voice and text chat to make sure this game can even be enjoyed by adolescents (and me).  Highly recommended!
Got friends? Got a family? Got a life? Not anymore you don't.  (Beware. A lot of rude people online, but otherwise a fantastic game)

Trying to explain just how fun this game is to people is pretty much impossible. I have tried and usually just get a 'deer in headlights' stare of bewilderment.  You could explain the mechanics; you play as a rocket powered RC car capable of jumping and flipping around the field, trying to score goals while flying acrobatically through the air... but that doesn't quite capture the pure excitement that Rocket League offers.  Not since Hawken have I experienced Overtime this intense and victories this satisfying and I honestly don't know why that is... but it is.  Negative points are few and far between but some may be: servers aren't quite capable of handling the thousands of people playing at once but the devs say they are working on it, and it has improved in the last few days. Another might be that the 'random' unlocks are for any car but the one you prefer to use but that's just PD2 'random' logic I'm already used too.  Overall, this game runs great; I get between 40 and 60+ fps on my upper-middle-class PC. It looks great even with all the AA's and motion blur turn on its not over the top. The controls work and feel great even for keyboard and mouse unlike some OTHER games... *cough* Speedrunners. It is absolutely worth $20 and I have nothing else to say.
Do I like football? No, I hate it. Do I like cars? No, I don't.  But then why do I absolutely LOVE rocket league?

This has been some of the most fun I've had playing an online game in a very long time. It's a game you really have to play, and feel, in order to truly understand the hype. This is a game I honestly think almost anyone can enjoy. Even if you're not typically a fan of sports games, like myself, or don't particularly like cars or racing, I still feel like there's a ton of enjoyment to be had with Rocket League. It's a game that is even more fun to play than it looks.  Every match creates an impressive sense of tension that makes each goal, assist, cross, clear or save feel extremely satisfying. The tight and responsive controls only add to this, as nearly every play or mistake simply comes down to your ability and timing. The controls are intuitive enough to pick up quickly but with an immense amount of depth. You can easily spend hundreds of hours honing your skills and still have room to improve. There's a huge skill cap and the gap between players can be extremely obvious. Thankfully, even the unranked matchmaking has MMR, so you generally always get matched against players of equal skill.  It looks as though things will only keep get better with the seasons and ranked divisions. There's currently ranked 1v1, team ranked 2v2, and solo ranked 3v3. They will be adding more in the near future including a team ranked 3v3 (Woo!). There's a lot of potential here for some amazing competitve gameplay and I can't wait to see it.  There's already a ton of stuff to unlock in-game as you level up; everything from new vehicles to a very large variety of ways to customize them, as well as some hidden secrets. You unlock things almost every game, so you always have something to look forward to. The devs want to support the game for years and will be adding more content to the game as time goes on. Some of it will be paid addons with new cars, ways to customize, etc., but every future map will be free to all.  TL;DR I can think of few better ways to spend $20 if you're looking for a really fun game that you can sink a ton of time into. This game makes me feel like a kid again, and I love it.  I have high hopes for this game! I will continue to update this review as I play more.

Well, usually I'm not the biggest writer - actually I haven't written a review at all. But when a game lets me pass the mark of 1,000 playing hours, I think it well deservers my first one.  Rocket League is a fascinating and exciting mixture of soccer, but with a special twist of not just being yet another simulation, but it introduced something else - flying cars. It is rather easy to start with, and in the beginning (and to be honest sometimes even now) you are happy when you hit the ball. Later on, when you've managed to advance through the game with your first goal (yeah!), your first aerial-goal (hell yeah!!) and nail-biting saves of balls that have crossed the line with 99% (holy s***!!!) you will realize: 'Hey, there are still guys out there that kick my a**!' and that there is still much to learn. But your effort and endurance will be rewarded with a fun, thrilling and competitive game, which will let you keep saying 'just 5 more minutes'...  But that's not all: Psyonix, the developer, is one of its kind. They do something, which is rare, maybe even extinct in the world of game developers and publishers: they listen to the community (crazy, right?)!  So here we are, a good year after the release of Rocket League and Psyonix has released several small (optional!) DLCs which primarily introduced new cars and they have released free updates which introduced new maps and play modes. After ice hockey and basketball which altered the map setting and/or the ball the newest addition 'Rumble' gave us a more fun oriented mode with all kinds of power-ups that will literally kick your and your opponents a**. These big additions were free, so if you want to, you can have an awesome game that'll entertain you for ages at a low-budget price. If you want to support this great bunch of people a bit more, you can buy the DLCs or some keys to the recently integrated crates. Both ways are not in any kind a 'pay2win' upgrade, but either just new cars or some stuff to pimp the visuals of your car.   So with Rocket League and its DLCs being on sale again right now, wait no longer, and buy this great piece of software - you will not regret it!
great game :))

FIFA with Rocket Cars.  Rocket League is one of those great ideas that may have found its way into little minigames embedded in larger games, but Psyonix finally decided to go ahead and make a full fledged experience dedicated to it. Essentially a soccer game where you drive a car to bump a giant soccer ball around, Rocket League has plenty of epic saves and amazing goals that keep you coming back for more. There is even a ranking system plus a competitive matchmaking mode for those who want to test their mettle against similarly skilled players.  Psyonix has also pledged to not introduce powerups or any changes to game balance, which is fantastic as all the cars handle the same essentially. I've heard rumors that some of the hitboxes and handling are slightly different between cars, but it is negligible at best. I've missed these kinds of games, where there are no silly 'perks' a la Call of Duty or car customization that can give you an edge in any way. It's just you, your car, and the ball. The new DLC cars are mostly novelties and haven't given an edge to any particular model of car, which is fantastic.  I've been following this game for quite some time so I bought it almost instantly when it was released. I highly recommend you pick it up if you're a fan of competitive sports games. Seeing as it's been top seller on steam for a couple weeks now, I'm sure this game will continue to have a healthy, active community for a long, long time.
Remember, no matter how bad you are, it's always your teammate's fault.

Pros: -Game has a high skill cap and is fairly easy to grasp first hand.  -You're constantly able to learn new techniques and hone your skill. -Fun for people at all skill/experience levels. -Skillcap is relatively low when compared to other (mobas/mmos) online games that you are able to contribute 100s of hours on. -YOU CAN ACTUALLY CARRY BAD TEAMMATES [more often than not]. -Games are less than 7 minutes in total about 90% of the time. -Very easy to gain skill simply by picking this game up from time to time. -Bang for buck; most people will find it easy to spend upwards of 100 hours on this game (at time of writing this review I am around 300 -Losing games is fairly manageable(even when someone afks) because of how short they are, you can just pick another up with minimal frustration. -Multiple modes of matchmaking make it easy to play with both friends and by yourself(co-op online w/ random people)  -Practice modes and training. -DLC and car choice/color does not effect play. You can spend no money on this game   Cons: -If someone afk's you're out of luck. -Rank system is immature (its currently too easy to drop and gain rank). -No report system for toxicity (aside from mute). -While I was able to get into high 400s in rank, I would DEFINATELY RECOMMEND A CONTROLLER. -Game is meant to be played with by a controller (you are unable to do certain movements on a keyboard but it is possible to get to higher ranks without the use of a controller)  Overall statement: I would definately recommend this game to anyone ranging from hardcore 80+hr a week gamer to a casual 2- hour a week gamer. I love this company and I love the direction they're taking this game. I see it doing really well in the future and for a mere 20$ you can get hundreds of hours of non-stop fun on a game thats different every time you play it. I first saw this game being streamed on twitch last year and decided I'd try it out. I was hooked within the first 2 games. This game is near impossible to put down once you get the hang of it.   BUY IT

*Controller Intro*: I'm playing this game with a PS4 controller pluged in the PC ( it works natively on Windows, without using any programs ) and the game recognises the controller as the PS4 controller, giving me all the controls in pop-ups accurately. I was kinda amazed.  Now for the gameplay. This is a fast and tactical game, despite all the chaos that will happen on the field. The controls are simple and easy to get used to just after a few games, but very hard to master. The goal of the game is to score a goal by wrestling with a GINORMOUS ball while fighting with your opponents and trying to coordinate with your team.  The matches are fun and exciting, lasting from 6 to 10 minutes, depending on the amount of goals scored in the match. The customization is wild and rampart, with the cars having the same 'stats', except the minor hitbox changes.  There are several game-modes, and if you're familiar with the FIFA or Pro Evolution Soccer games, you will understand what they are. You have the Exhibition game mode where you play ONE match with your adjustable settings. You have the Season game mode consisting of multiple matches that follow a basic tournament format. And you have the Play Online mode (currently down on 7.7.15, the launch day) that has Unranked and Ranked game modes.  If you are a fan of fun, this is a game for you.

I had a bit of a wierd sexual development, y'know. Instead of a girlfriend at age 16, I had some 50 year-old chick who treated me as though I was having a sort of affair with her. Do you know what I mean? She definitely treated me as a 'bit of stuff' rather than as an equal. I mean, this was completely fine with me. I was doing this awesome hot chick, and moreover one who was unavailable to my peers. Man, I bet they wish they had the sort of sexual education I did!  After a while though, it started to grate, because she'd never take my opinions seriously, and that kinda rankled. Still I was 16, and she had, like, multiple degrees, so I counldn't blame her. Eventually, I moved away and we just sort of stopped seeing each other. I kind of wish we'd kept in touch and stuff, because there's been multiple times I could have used her wisdom and erudition. Still, all things must end, eh?  Anyway, ever since then, my life has been a pattern of affairs; I never really quite found the pursuit of single girls as fulfilling and rewarding as when you get some married broad to cheat on her husband through simply being a better man than him. Now, I kind of regret not settling down earlier, because I seem to have a lot of trust issues, always wondering when they'll end it and go back to their spouses. Still, it's better to regret something you did, than something you didn't, I guess.  So, anyway, and this is a bit of a sad end to the story, so sorry 'bout that. She died recently - I only noticed because of the obituaries in the paper - and it turns out she left something to me in her will. Well, not her will exactly, but the solicitor called me up to say there was an envelope with my name on it. It was dated only a few weeks after we broke up.  I'm not afraid to tell you I was kinda scared by this; my blood literally ran cold when I saw her ever familar script on the envelope. I was kinda shaking when I read it, and despite the fact it's kinda private (and a little bit sexy!) I kinda want to tell you guys what it said. It's important, and I think everyone should know. This is what it said:  'You have like the most amazing ♥♥♥♥ in the world. And Rocket League is really, really good.'

This is a game with which I have arguably had the most fun! This is also one of the few games that I have ever bought so much DLC Content for (Skyrim and South Park: The Stick of Truth are pretty much the only others), because I typically don't like spending the extra money. However, I've yet to come across another game that allows me to geek out like Rocket League does. Come on, where else can you dirve the Official Back to the Future Time-Machine Delorean, or the Bat-Mobile from Batman v. Superman: Dawn of Justice?  Since I bought this game, Psyonix has added Hockey and Hoops as online servers; and as of today (June 20) they're adding Neo Tokyo (and here I am with an addictive sweet-tooth for all things Japanese), along with another arena for Rocket Labs (which I thoroughly enjoy)! I've also purchased another copy of this game to give to a friend since getting this game.  I truly hope that Psyonix keeps releasing new content for this game, as it is the Only sports-style game I have ever enjoyed, and will ever play!  Oh! Is a hot dog a sandwich?  No. No it isn't. And let me tell you why. Sandwiches are held like this = where each line represents a piece of bread and the empty space is the stuff inside. A hot dog looks like this from above | | where the two parallel lines are the buns and the space is the hot dog and various condiments. Were you to turn your hot dog like this = all your relish, ketchup, and other various things would fall out and you'd be stuck with little to nothing but a wiener in between A SINGLE PIECE of bread. However were you to turn a sandwich like this | |, the worst that would happen, provided it was made correctly, is that it would just be hard to eat. This is my argument, I will defend it to my last breath. A hot dog. Is not. A sandwich.

It seems like such a little kid game: whacky looking racecars hitting a soccer ball. But my one friend had about 80 hours of play time and insisted that it was a great game. So did everyone else within the massive amount of positive reviews. Also, I hadn't played a car driving game in a while. With that said, I added it to my wishlist and the moment it went on sale I bought it.  Here I am now with over 100 hours of play time that FLEW by.  Beautiful clean graphics and game menus. Crystal clear audio with fun electronic songs when in menu. Playing with friends has always worked perfectly for me, whether online or split screen. Believe it or not I prefer playing with the keyboard, but the Xbox 360 controller works great, as does the PS4 controller. I love playing with friends but it's very fun going solo as well, and I don't say that often. Many 'hats' and 'antennas' to style your car with. Many paint types and colors to style your car with. A decent amount of cars to pick from. A decent amount of arenas and game modes to choose from, or create your own rules in your own arena and invite friends. If you don't have any friends the game's bots work well, although they are pretty easy even when set to their hardest difficulty. I'd equate the bots on 'All-Star' to a real player who is around 'Semi-Pro'. There is an exp point system and leveling up, but it doesn't do anything other than change the status displayed underneath your name such as 'Rookie, Semi-Pro, Pro, Veteran, Expert, Master, Legend' of which you can opt out of displaying. There are multiple camera options (can be very helpful) and graphics options. There are multiple servers in many regions, and you can toggle which regions to connect to. Also, the developers keep the game updated and release both free and purchasable content from time to time.  The game itself is soccer but with cars. Cars that can jump! And if you are good enough, cars that can even fly haha. There are boost pads that speed you up and you can use the boost to 'aerial' as well.   Cool side-note: This is the first game for PC that is cross-platform with both Xbox One and Playstation 4 players. If you are playing a match and notice someone's picture says 'PSY NET' that means that they are using a console.  Not much else to say other than try this game out for yourself!

Pros: -Fun with singles, doubles, and standard -Easy to learn, hard to master type gameplay -Deep gameplay mechanics -Creative -Sorta balanced  Cons: -Wasteland sucks, and should not be added to ranked (too big, should only be used for unranked/chaos). This isn't a 'oh 20XX only final destination' type thing, this is moreso like banning Hyrule Temple. -Network issues - you will hit the ball so many times and NOTHING will happen, you'll just pass through. Then there's the issue of seeing one thing and the other actually happening, such as you hitting the ball but on the server side you flipped too late or something. Very bogus. -Physics sometimes don't make sense - ball seemingly speeds up for no reason, car takes a very long time to fall but the ball seems to fall very fast (or sometimes very slow, really depends), hitting the ball below max boost can *sometimes* put it to full speed while others not, it seems very inconsistent -Not a lot of transparency from the devs - 'all cars are exactly the same....okay they have different hitboxes but other than that they're still completely the sa--...okay yeah they all have different turn radiuses but that's not a big deal cause everywhere else they're still the same.'  Choosing your car IS important, some need cars that pop it up easier, like the hotshot, and some want to keep it on the ground, like the merc. Except you probably shouldn't choose the merc if you can't powerslide properly yet as that has almost the worst turn radius in the game. Why they feel the need to hide this from the players is beyond me.  They also completely hide the matchmaking, having hidden MMR that pairs you up. Even though the matchmaking sucks. You either get dominated or you dominate. Hardly ever in between. Even though I was in bronze I was still getting matched up with gold players. Which is absolutely ridiculous.   I still recommend this game because if you play it for ten minutes here and there, it's really fun and if you wanna play a lot more, it's still really fun. But everytime I play I eventually stop because of frustration. Mostly because of the physics engine ♥♥♥♥ing up, like not transferring momentum properly.  Also, side note as this is not critical of the actual game, the community is VERY toxic. If you aren't good, everyone trash talks you, including your teammates. A lot of smurfing goes on and they are consistently ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s, making fun of people that only have 30 hours in the game whereas they have 700. So yeah, be aware of that.

Few things to start with: - I hate racing games - i don't like soccer games - i LOVE Rocket League  When you first see this game you might be like: 'Soccer and cars? Oh, really? Cool idea, but this cannot be fun.' If you are afraid wasting your money (It's often on sales, 3rd party sites, buying game for cs;go/tf2 keys), then trust me: YOU WILL NOT REGRET It's possible that you checked youtube videos for this game and have seen all those fancy aerials, sick dribbles and breathtaking freestyles. Well... Don't expect to be that good at the beginning. Don't be suprised when you have less than 15hrs... you will rather miss the ball on ground than touch it xD But... after spending more and more hours in this game you'll notice that you are slowly getting better and better. It's very satisfying. Just rly... When i was a pro (like 30-60hrs into the game [i dont remember how many hours it takes to get 20-29 lvl sry]) i did my first aerial goal and i was like: 'AHHHHHH!!! IM SO GUT FEELSGOODMAN' but then i checked some youtube videos and were like: 'Okay... FeelsBadMan'.  This game is easy to play and hard to master and gives a lot of fun (as long as you dont meet salty kid [Ignore him/ mute him]). Try it out :) 11/10. Spent +700 hrs at the time of writing this review. Will play more :D

This game is made up of 3 ingredients: endorphin, adrenaline and salt.  Edit: Closing in on 600h, first review update. This is still my favorite game and it saves me a lot of money. ie. Game XXX go on sale, super hyped AAA game YYY launched next week with 10/10 review. And what goes through my head is, 'well, I can wait next sale or become cheaper, cause I will be playing Rocket League anyway.' I think besides VR games, I've only bought Alienation on PS4, but it is a loot grinding game, kinda of not what I expected from Housemarque. Right now I'm working on improving car controls and pretty much leveling up all aspects of mechanic, wall challenge, possession control, passing etc. There is less salt and adrenaline involved now, to me Rocket League now become a super fast pacing 'status analysis' game, you constantly evaluate situations, both enemy and team mates, you try to be consistent at what you do, but not too predictable facing enemy challenge. It's like a 4 or 6 players team smash game where everything and anything could happen in the stadium.  For newer player though, don't get frustrated or discouraged. No one play that good from day one. Just like any other game, there are some really talented guy that will 'get it' and be able to do whatever they like cause either they are young and brain adapt new things faster, or they have other games that trains their reflex/muscle so it's easier to transition to this game. Just aiming to 'have fun', all the efforts you make to improve your skill is to enjoy more fun when engage other players online. Yes, there will be trolls and toxic players, who cares? At 600 hours, I just laugh at those flaming/troll comments, it's just those few games in the thousands of matches. Bad player will exists if Rocket League is popular, cause everyone will face against someone better eventually, you could be matched with team mate less skilled than you do. And if everything isn't going your way, before venting/ranting on your team mates, think about 'having fun' and work on getting better while the more skillful player is present. You can only improve playing with people that are better than you, observe and think what you are missing from replays, and practice, practice, practice even more until you can also do those ♥♥♥♥ they do without thinking or brain go blank. :)

Simply, this game is great and I reccomend it to everyone. The game is pretty simple. It's soccer with cars. But, it's much more than that. There are many skills that you can master in the game such as striking, aerials, and playing goalie. There is also a CS:GO-like ranking system for different game modes of Rocket League such as solo-standard, doubles, and singles. They each have their perks of playing them.  In singles, you just depend on yourself and no teammates but in solo standard, you depend a lot on your teammates, whether that be a good thing or a bad thing. Although, it's not just about the soccer. There are cosmetics that you can collect such as car skins and wheels and Psyonix just released crates which you can open with keys that you buy from the store. A portion of the cost of the key is supposed to go to future Rocket League events. All in all, the game is great.

I'm here to tell you all about the positions in Rocket League.  Striker: You're job is to score goals and keep the ball on the opponents side. But whatever you do, DON'T MISS A SHOT. You will be hated on until you want to uninstall.  If you score a goal, hope you don't have that one guy who spams 'What A Save' after every goal. You will get hate.  MidField:  Most People don't even know that this is a position. You're job is to keep the ball from going too far back.  You want to try and set up your Strikers for goals. Unfortunately, the second you miss an Ariel or any hit, you're going to get hate. But it feels so good when you hit an Ariel. So keep calm and waste that boost.  Goalie/Keeper: This is probably the most important positions in the game. You're job is to keep the ball out of your net and to clear it up to your midfielders. But be warned, the opponents, and sometimes your own team, will constantly run into you and get in your way. Missing a Save results in a goal and your opponents getting real mad at you.  Oh, and don't be that guy who gets the best spawn and stays back. Just don't.   Well, that's it.  My review on Rocket League. Hopefully this boosts your interest in the game. -Frost.

Pros: -Very pretty and well optimised -Only 2.6gb in size -Fun, addictive gameplay -Tons of customization options -All DLC is cheap and provides no ingame advantage -Amazing Soundtrack -Cross Platform Gameplay (With the PS4) -Easy to play with friends in both private and public matches -Not Fifa -Easy to pick up, with a high skill cap -Only possible advantage over other players is skill -Good Servers with little/no lag (provided you are playing on your continent) -Great physics -Matchmaking is pretty good -Community is alright -Easy to play with either a Controller or Keyboard+Mouse -Singleplayer vs Bots -Bot AI is (mostly) quite good -Options are quite fleshed out if you get picky about graphics and anit-aliasing etc -Great fun, even if you are not a sports or football fan -Continued Game support -Mutators (ala Killing Floor and L4D2) for singleplayer and multiplayer -Well implemented Replay system for videos and screenshots -No bugs (that I have found) -Ice Hockey   Cons: -Bots sometimes do stupid things -No LAN currently implemented ingame

The community feels a bit dead on the forums compared to almost every other popular game I play. I'm really not sure why that is, but it's not a huge issue or anything. Matchmaking is a bit funky, sometimes I get put against people of equal rank and other times they are 3+ ranks higher and this is when I don't wait a while for matches.. A game that is built on skill, but not impossible for anyone. A good matchmaker that eventually allows for even and good matches no matter how skilled you yourself are. Go ranked and get a rating that will set the matchup, or play unranked and get set mainly based on your experience, the amount of match you've played in total (I think). The game also includes various options to play by yourself against bots (including a league), and for unranked games, if the teams are uneven in number of players, a bot will replace until someone else joins. On top of that, the DLC's are all about skins basically, you can get different cars, but there's no difference in performance, so there's no pay to win in any way.   Overall, it's easy enough for some quick enjoyment, and if you like, you can develop some pretty serious skill and work your way up the ranking system. For the ranked games, you start of with 10 games as unranked, before you achieve a rank in the lowest (prospect) division. For me this game has given very good value for the money, and I recommend it strongly.

Rocket League. You get crazy cars with rockets on them, You fly around the arena trying to hit the ball before your opponents organize themselves in some sort of way to get a play going. But it always fails, at first. You blast in with full rocket boost at the ball or you drive so slowly to hit the ball is doesn't do anything at all.   Then you learn, you learn how to double-flip, how to dribble the ball, how to finally get that first aerial. It's very satisfying. And while you've been trying to learn all those moves you've accumulated over 100 in-game hours.   I picked up Rocket League not expecting much, just some quick fun, short 5-minute matches. I then played quite a few 5 minute matches and it's very enjoyable. You can become a crazy pro online if you want or you can sit back, put some music on and play casual matches.  I like it.

What can I say about Rocket League other than it is one of the most addictive games I have ever played. I gave it a shot, played it with a friend got my ♥♥♥ stomped for  about 20 hours. Told my friends about it, everyone bought it. We do 2,3,4's nightly and even when we get stomped we look forward to the next match for redemption.  The fact that AAA devs cannot make a game like this says a lot. There is a lot of over thinking in todays gaming culture, buzzwords, hype culture. All that ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t none of them is necessary for Rocket League. Its soccer cars. They have a league  system that is is fun to climb and easy to fall out of. The game feels like the right amount of easy to pick up and play yet incredibly hard to master. This is what keeps my friends and I coming back night after night. To yell at eachother and  shout like idiots when we pull off some amazing move we have never done before.  Its teamwork. Simple team work and my god is it rewarding. For 30 bucks? This game is a steal and a half. I bought all the DLC which is all cosmetic becuse the base game was so god damn good I had to suppor the developers further. That says to me that they have made something special in a market cluttered by cookie cutter ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t and everyones charging full ♥♥♥♥ing price.   The problems with the game are minor but need to be addressed. I play on the mouse and keyboard (yes I am ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥) and the input delay/negation of the right mouse button commands (which effect jumping) are awful. I thought it was my mouse dying at first. So I bought a new mouse, same thing happened looked on the forums. Its a known game issue. If you are using a controller  you will be fine though. Next problem, pings and matchmaking. Pings seem a bit irratic even being on the same region but that is to be expected I suppose. Matchmaking seems off as we can have a fantastic match in game 1, then in games 2-4 we get rickrolled completely. Little things that need to be fine tuned and everythings fine. So no major complaints.   If you have buddies you like to game with, and want a simple yet challenging game pick this sucker up. You owe it to yourselves.   Rocket League gets 9 out of 10 from me in every regard. Nearly the perfect game overall and the best Indie game I have ever played.   GO BUY IT

For all those who are providing negative reviews due to the multiplayer situation, please take the following into consideration:  1. The game is FREE on PS4 2. There are 1.2 million people on PS4 playing this game 3. There are 5000 (peak) on PC playing this game 4. This is cross platform, thus PS4 and PC users share the same dedicated server service. 5. The developers did not anticipate there being this may people playing the game. 6. There are currently not enough server due to the PS4 users and they're adding more as time goes on.  I believe the developers are now aware of the situtation and will do their best to support all us PC users.  I would definitely recommend this game. Until the servers are sorted out, I'm very happy sticking with season mode.

So far I have played 18 hours but it feels like I've spent less. Time really flies by when you're chasing the ball with your car.  If you like soccer(football) or cars that you can do tricks with, this game is for you. You can play 1v1, 2v2, 3v3 or 4v4, with or without your friends, non-ranked or ranked.  Customizing your cars is easy and fun. You can have different colors and designs stenciled on your cars, as well as different decorative flags and hats, yes hats, for your cars. When you use 'boost' in game, you can even apply different exhaust smoke/ribbon that shoot out of your car. You can have normal smoke, stars, money, rainbow ribbon, flowers or even have snow coming out.   Game time is 5 minutes per match.  Good sized maps and it is easy to learn but it is very hard to master, you can for example 'fly' with your car and you can also drive on the walls. Driving on the walls and or using the boost to fly takes practice to do so effectivly. Don't expect to be the best player in one hour, like with other games. This game really brings out the competitive side in me and I bet it will bring it out in you too.  I can safetly say that I have not started to be burnt out by this game. Most games only keep your attention and the feel of 'Oh, I really want to continue to play this' for so long. When I wake up in the morning I feel like I need to play this game.  I'd say if you're a competitive gamer that likes something easy to get into but takes time to shine like a pro, this is the game for you.

Have you ever wanted to play a sport AND drive a car? You've probably answered yes, but now I ask you: 'Have you ever wanted to do both of those at the same time?' Assuming you've never played the prequel 'Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket-Powered Battle-Cars!' you probably think that I'm crazy for even asking such a question.   The concept of the game is quite simple: use your battle-car to hit the ball around a field and try to score goals. In fact, the concept is so simple that I imagine several big developers *cough*EA*cough* are slapping themselves over not having come up with the game first. With that being said, the game itself can be very complex with many of the strategic choices being reminiscent of actual sports - except with rockets... and not having to be outside - which on its own provides enough depth that the game borders on casual/hardcore fun.   Many of the unlockables are nice to look at and allow the player to customise their own little car into something that passes for a personality statement. The customisation itself, unfortunately, is limited in that you can only have one topper equipped at a time which leaves the siren + fire helmet combination hanging in the wind.   Graphically the game is pleasing to look at and each of the cars are distinct which adds to the clarity during what can often be chaotic matches. The different fields have their own styles as well as several variations which add interesting little events to the outside.  The music seems to only play during the menu but the developers have been kind enough to provide the official soundtrack for only USD$4.99, so that you can enjoy the music while you're in the game. This is of course a hint to the developers to provide an option to have the music play during matches.   The sounds are fairly good and you will hear various crowd reactions to different things happening in the game which is definitely a nice touch.  The game can be played with either mouse/keyboard or a controller. However, out of the two the controller is heavily recommended since the game adds itself to the 'play this while sitting in a comfortable chair at some distance to your screen' school of thought. Although, if you find yourself without a controller the mouse/keyboard will do just fine.   Overall, I highly recommend this game to anyone who is looking for something to pass the time and looking for something simple yet highly addictive.

This game is awesome, it's totally worth its full price, if you are able to get it on discount, don't think twice. JUST. DO IT.  - It's football with (ROCKET) cars, I mean. Now you decide whether that is a good or a bad thing, IMO it is definitely a great thing. - You can and you should play it with friends, it is like so much fun to do it, especially if you both suck in the beginning (which is totally understandable). - If you are not the type of guy who likes to play with friends (2x2, 3x3, 4x4) or for that matter, in a team, you can always play 1x1 matches. So yeah, you've got that covered. - It has a LOT of customization, including low-priced (4euroish) DLCs, so you can create your very own distinguished vehicle.  Why are you still reading this? It is a 10 out of 10 (YES, 10/10 GUYS), buy it, install it, play it, if you are not the kind of guy who only plays games you instantly get to be great at, you probably won't regret any of it.

Rocket League is... Wow. Unique, competitive, addictive, easy to learn with an insanely high skill ceiling... There really is no reason to not own this game, especially with its low cost.  Maybe you're one of the people who look at this game and think 'Looks fun, but it's just so SILLY, there's no way I'd get THAT into it!' Those were the words of my friend who I had to convince to get the game, and he now has over 500 hours invested into it. Seriously, if you think you MIGHT like it, you will.  On top of how amazing the base game is, they also keep adding more to keep it fresh. New fields (mostly standard, but we're starting to see crazy fields), gamemodes (we saw crazy mutators, ice hockey, and rocket labs, with basketball coming out next week), and DLC. The way that their DLC works is great. Never will you miss out on a field or gamemode because you don't have DLC; DLC is purely for cosmetic car changes. The DLC's are also always very fairly priced, bringing awesome looking cosmetic choices for only a couple of dollars.  Do I have any gripes about the game? Sure, they just don't come close to outweighing the positives. The community can be quite toxic, leaving in the middle of matches and insulting other players, but that's not out of the ordinary for competitive online games. Psyonix also perhaps didn't listen to the community closely enough, especially regarding Wasteland. A LOT of players hate the field, and really didn't want it in ranked, and yet it seemed to become the most common field to play on in ranked, and stayed that way for a long time. They did, however, recently update the physics in a way that will likely cause less hatred of the field.  As one final note, you DO need a controller for this game. There are PC controls, but very few players can do much with those controls beyond the basics. A wired XBox 360 controller has worked perfectly for me. Get this game, use a controller, and have a blast.

Great game, you really should try Apple Pie. RecPIE:  For the filling 1kg Bramley apples 140g golden caster sugar ½ tsp cinnamon 3 tbsp flour For the pastry 225g butter, room temperature 50g golden caster sugar, plus extra 2 eggs 350g plain flour, preferably organic softly whipped cream, to serve ( Really recomend the whipped cream)  1.Put a layer of paper towels on a large baking sheet. Quarter, core, peel and slice the apples about 5mm thick and lay evenly on the baking sheet. Put paper towels on top and set aside while you make and chill the pastry. For the pastry, beat the butter and sugar in a large bowl until just mixed. Break in a whole egg and a yolk (keep the white for glazing later). Beat together for just under 1 min – it will look a bit like scrambled egg. Now work in the flour with a wooden spoon, a third at a time, until it’s beginning to clump up, then finish gathering it together with your hands. Gently work the dough into a ball, wrap in cling film, and chill for 45 mins. Now mix the 140g/5oz sugar, the cinnamon and flour for the filling in a bowl that is large enough to take the apples later. After the pastry has chilled, heat the oven to 190C/fan 170C/gas 5. Lightly beat the egg white with a fork. Cut off a third of the pastry and keep it wrapped while you roll out the rest, and use this to line a pie tin – 20-22cm round and 4cm deep – leaving a slight overhang. Roll the remaining third to a circle about 28cm in diameter. Pat the apples dry with kitchen paper, and tip them into the bowl with the cinnamon-sugar mix. Give a quick mix with your hands and immediately pile high into the pastry-lined tin. Brush a little water around the pastry rim and lay the pastry lid over the apples pressing the edges together to seal. Trim the edge with a sharp knife and make 5 little slashes on top of the lid for the steam to escape. (Can be frozen at this stage.) Brush it all with the egg white and sprinkle with caster sugar. Bake for 40-45 mins, until golden, then remove and let it sit for 5-10 mins. Sprinkle with more sugar and serve while still warm from the oven with softly whipped cream. Recipe from Good Food magazine, October 2004

Rocket League Review   I absolutely love this game. The controls are quite smooth when using a controller. I've found that as you play the game, you'll master more tricks. I've gotten pretty good in the few (few meaning 58) hours that I've played Rocket League.   The developers, Psyonix, are also incredible. They really care about their players and do everything they can to make sure that people are having a great experience. They also charge reasonable prices. No DLC for $40 *Cough* EA *Cough* I thank them for everything they've done, and will do, for us.   I'd definitely recommend this game to friends. I've already gotten one friend hooked on Rocket League, and I hope to get a few more on board. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have a few goals to score. ;)

Could not recommend this any higher.

For someone who is writing this review with just under 15 hours of experience, this game is very, very fun. It is also replayable, and I like games that are replayable rather than one time purchases that you'll only play for ten or so hours.  It is different from most games, to say the least. No complex purchasing system or overpowered football players in rare card packs, whether you win or lose a game depends on your skill and the strategy you and your fellow cars play out. Playing with friends is recommended, as you can rotate in positions such as attacking or defending.  The customisation is great, and quite possibly my favourite. As you complete games, you unlock new items. Some are rarer than others, but the common items are great too. There are some cool items I've unlocked, such as Deadmau5. The cars are good too. Some are suited for different purposes, but I always find myself using the DLC cars from the Supersonic pack. Dominus is my personal favourite, alongside the Takumi. What I am impressed by is not just the system and the cool items, but the wide variation of customisation. Colours, decals, antennas, wheels, even boost types, this game has it. I like the nods to other games such as Portal, too. My favourite feature so far is that this game is not purchase heavy. No cases or boxes that require keys you buy from the marketplace to open. You get items, and nothing else is required. I'm so happy the system works like this.   The community can be okay sometimes, but I've come across some toxic games. Disabling the chat helps, but I can't play a competitive 1v1 match without someone leaving when I'm clearly going to win. Yeah, still a win, but it kills the fun of the match. Maybe a sanctioning system for leaving competitive games could fix this, such as a time out?  The visuals are stunning. In my opinion, they are better than any other game I have played, rivalling with Rise of Tomb Raider. I didn't expect the visuals to be so stunning, but when I saw the incredible detail of the main menu alone, I knew that this was going to be a beautiful game.  Overall, it's outstanding. In fact, I see it being a top favourite. Seeking as I've played other games for much longer than 15 hours, this game has met my expectations and beyond. Maybe I'm overhyping this a little bit, but for someone who is a fan of competitive games like this, it's epic in my eyes. A purchase that if you consider, you won't regret.

If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.  Ingredients: 1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter 2. 1/2 cup white sugar 3. 1/2 cup brown sugar 4. 1/4 cup water 5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon 6. 1 pinch salt 7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced 8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie   Directions: 1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). 2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside. 3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices. 4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal. 5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust. 6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Shorth anwser: Rocket League is an amazing arcady game. You should definatly buy it. The cosmetics, the matches, the community is trully amazing!  In-depth review: This game is really addicting and cool. The graphics are good. The idea of the game may sound boring (football/soccer with cars), but when you start playing the game, you think how the developers came up with this amazing game. There are a ton of cosmetic items (more than 200 collectible items), which allow you to make your ride really unique (I'm 99% sure that you will never find the same car as yours, unless its your friend). I think the developers did a great job on the cosmetic items. The best aspect of the game is that it's not pay to win (buying stuff will not give you an advantage over other players). Now I want to talk about the community. The players you will meet will be either very kind (about 70% of them), or really mean (about 30% of them). The kind players will say compliments to you everytime you make a goal, assist, save, etc..., but the mean players will either say that they're better than you (even if your'e winning) or ragequit (which is actually good for you xD). The game gets old after half a year (my opinion), but I find myself playing the game after 1 month of a break. If you have a real life friend who plays this game too (I don't), then Rocket League is really, really fun. But of course, you can always play it with a friend, which you met on this game and it is still really fun to play. I want to mention, that if you saw those epic clips on YouTube, where people do 360 backflip-kickflip-somersault aeriel shots, you will probably need more than 250 hours of playing (I have 190 hours in total and I barely make aerials). Anyways, if you like addicting, fun, arcady games, this game should be perfect for you.   Hope you enjoyed my review :).
Very fun game, even if your not into soccer or cars, or if you are into either soccer or cars, you should get this game.

Day 1: This game seems simple enough. Hit the ball in the opponents goal. Easy.   Day 100: You start to develop strategies in attacking and defending and are slowly getting better at hitting the ball to wherever you want. You think you're pretty good at this game.   Day 365: You're always where you need to be on the field to make the play. You hit the ball every time to where you want it to go. Either the goal or a teammate it doesn't matter, you think you're excellent at this game.   Day 366: You watch the pro's play and realise you're absolute garbage at Rocket League.  10/10 losing all confidence isn't that bad at all.

This game is unlike anything you've played before, unless you played its predesesor, SARPBC. Easy to pick up and play either solo or with your friends but extremely difficult to master, Rocket League has a similar system to CsGo in terms of ranks. The game will look simple at first, i mean just run into the ball with your car and score. Right? Wrong, there are no limits on what you can to like aerials, dribbling, freestyling, etc. When you get the hang of these things the game just gets more fun and intense. There are new maps and dlc released every few months and the developers have done a good job keeping the game well optimized and balanced. Overall, whether you play this game casually or competatively, you will enjoy playing it.

It is extremely difficult to describe the joy of crossing someone on a mad drive to the goal. The entire opposing team is throwing all they have at you, at every turn there’s a revving engine and burning rocket motor trying to get in between you and your fleeting, but oh so enjoyable fame. With every juke you shatter the opposing team’s hope of victory (as well as your teammate’s hopes of ever touching the ball) and end up just yards from the goal (meters in people that haven’t been to the moon units.) You let loose with the most savage double jump crossover on the goalie as you can. The ball screeches into the goal and detonates sending all on the pitch careening across the field in a frenzy of jumps and spontaneous boosts celebrating your play. You ease back in your chair and realize after getting all those white stars in Upward you can finally become the “Soccar” star you’ve always dream to be…

Well I've owned this game for close to a year now (just under a month left as of Nov. 2), and I want to reiterate and say that I still love this game. As my skills have improved, I've found that the game can be a lot more fun at times, than when I had first started off. I say 'at times' only because it can also be very frustrating, being paired relatively often with people that are much better than I am. I don't want to say that the ranked system isn't good, but it can still use a little more work. That is NOT to say, however, that about 70-80% of the time it works out well, pairing me up with others at my own skill level.  One thing I don't really care for though is the recent addition of crates and microtransactions. I really wish that you could just earn the keys to unlock crates, even if they were very rare, while still having the option to buy keys if people so desire. But the fact that you can  only  buy keys is disappointing. I understand full well that the game states the profits mostly go to hosting championships, but I highly doubt they are pressed for money given the success of the game.   Either way, despite a couple negatives I have mentioned, the gameplay is still a blast, and the developers continue to add free arenas and gamemodes, which is awesome. There's definitely a reason I have over 400 hours invested into this game.  'Just five more minutes...'

Amazing game, way more fun than I expected. DLC is done right i.e. all items are cosmetic - there's no pay to win model. All cars have equal sized hitboxes and equal sized boost capacity. One of the few games where the only difference between winning and losing is skill. There's no theorycrafting, no spreadsheets, no lame stats etc. Just plain fun.  The only letdown is that it's a bit of a wild west as far as cheating is concerned. One of the problems I've particularly encountered is what I can best describe as 'multiboxing' as in World of Warcraft where one player controls more than one character simultaneously. Often leads to a very unfair advantage. Also it would be great if there were a feature to report AFK players and offensive player nicks.

In this review ,I can tell you the step of the classes/group of levels in this game ( which you newbies WILL Acquired it)   Rookie : ITS JUST SO HARD TO TOUCH THE BALL , you will feel like a stupid car run out of boost while shooting thin air.   Semi-Pro : You will hit the ball once per while, and you will make that little smile in your heart while you at it. You crave for that ' Nice Shot! ' or ' What A Save!' but still you cant do it   Pro : Well... you not really a pro yet but a better person and skill than Semi-Pro. You can aim the ball towards you want but maybe 45 degrees or maybe 90 degrees where you aim it. Still, nice try. You will try aerial or flying your car several times even its gonna be too high  Veteran : Welcome to the world of basic aerial! Your ground work much better now ,your aerial become useful for the team , but sometime burden. you can basicly dribble the ball towards the goal. You can Save the ball easier now because you know where it headed.Still you cant save f**ing Expert Shooting from aerial in not reasonable place to shot.(This is where i am right now)   Expert :You're that f**ing Expert Shooting from aerial in not reasonable place to shot. Because when you see the ball in the air you gonna start flying and actually HIT the the ball where nobody cant reach it,you missed the ball several times but your team or your enemy WILL not care because they know You.Are.Pro. Also you can hit Wall Aerials which is SO HARD TO DO.  Master : I Met them, a lot. i can tell you one thing about Masters. YOUR WORST NIGHTMARE. Passing , shooting , basic aerial , dribbling , wall shot they can do it no sweat. If you a master now , well you can smile a bit because We are scared of you and if we got you in our team. 'OMG'  Legend: I only met legend twice , My god you will not understand the physics you learn in Highshool. WHAT THE FU** WITH THAT AIR DRIBBLE? Trust me if you see what i saw , ur ded.Also shooting and dribbling = Messi. SO ACCURATE.  Rocketeer : Funny i met Rocketeer in matchmaking 3-4 times , more than a legend. They have all the Legend traits but they got one that no one have. A COMPLETE PLAYER TRAIT. If this guy play defense. That f**ing Expert Shooting from aerial in not reasonable place to shot is gonna be blocked. If this guy play strike well you need another Rocketeer or maybe Veteran Legends to match up, or maybe a good teamwork can save you. THE BALL WILL RARELY TOUCH THE GROUND. They even intentionally pass the ball to the air and then another rocketeer intentionally BACKFLIP HIT IT TOWARDS THE GOAL. More than a worst nightmare. Its your grave  Well that's all i can tell about Rocket League Classes from my experience. if somone disagree like ' Im a rookie but i can hit aerials!' feel free to write comments  Anyway , Greatest.Multiplayer.Ever with great community (you wont meet 'Your momma' jokes here') with a lot great tutorial in youtube that you can learn from.AND THIS AWESOME CARS  11/10

├Honest Review┤ Review is based on current state of game.  Game Pros • Highly Addicting • Split Screen Multiplayer  • 60 FPS (Its capped, but unlockable if you really want more frames. But 60 is just swell) • Supports In-game voice/text chat • Low ping (Make sure to select your region in the server filters) • Clean Interface  • Smooth Gameplay  • Customizable cars (You can even give them hats!) • In-game replay recorder (Just hit 'save replay' after any match) • Incredible visuals  • Controller support (The game suggests to use a controller, but honestly, the keyboard works perfectly. All preference)  Game Cons • Slight lag after letting go of the VoIP button (F) • No punishment for players abandoning a match • Reports of crashing/freezing while watching replays  • Has the chance of crashing/losing connection after a round if you're in a group and not the party leader  Relateable Games • Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket-Power Battle-Cars  Conclusion Rocket League is an amazing game. I would honestly reccomend this game to anyone. Unless you REALLY hate soccer, and you simultaneously REALLY hate cars.  (If you found this review helpful, consider giving it a thumbs up!)

I'm still a bit of a beginner, but this is a very enjoyable game. There is a skill-curve, so don't get too disheartened until you've gotten a little practice.  You will need a stable, decent internet connection to enjoy this game properly, as single-player stops being challenging once you advance past a certain skill level. DLC is for aesthetic purposes only.  Multiplayer is the real draw for this game, as you can play with friends and/or other players on your servers. Don't be afraid to lose - most of your matches will be assigned according to a skill-based algorithm which goes up and down depending on how well you play. Therefore, statistically you WILL start to lose once you get matched against players in higher ranks than you. PLEASE consider this when you want to rage-quit whenever your team is losing. Just let the algorithm kick you back down until your skill improves.

Rocket League is an intense and thoroughly enjoyable game even for people who hate sports or suck at games.  Pros:     Very fast reaction based game with solid mechanics (you can ♥♥♥♥ing fly!) and a high skill cap.     Fun game even when your losing badly (as I often am).      Good soundtrack.      Nice graphics and art style.      Great performance with me having everything maxed 1440p without fps dips below 60.     Several game types both ranked (with a fun and rewarding ranking system) and unranked.     Good level of car customisation.      Some nice cosmetic loot based progression for the first 20 hours.     Fairly priced DLC that gives no ingame advantage being purely cosmetic.     Splitscreen on PC! ♥♥♥♥ing awesome feature I wish more games had.     Cross-platform; get ready to rekt some PlaySation noobs :)     Good support for both controller as well as keyboard and mouse.      Reasonably friendly community (there are definitely some ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s though) with a large player base meaning you will always find games quickly.   Cons:     Some game modes such as 4v4 I find too chaotic and less enjoyable.     Bots are dumb and easy to play agaisnt; not much use for trying to improve on except for beginner players.     Single player is a nice addition but lacks behind other car games campaign modes and isnt as enjoyable as the multiplayer.     No support for higher resolutions such as 1440p and 4k in the menus by default (although you can easily fix this by going into the games file and manually changing the resoltution without any issues.).     Rare server issues that make collision detection a ♥♥♥♥♥.  Despite naming a few cons these are mostly nitpicks which are greatly outweighed by the overwhelming number of positive features this game has, making Rocket League a game I would strongly recommend!

It goes without saying that I love this game, so far I've spend over 135 hours playing it.  The review in short:  Pros: - It's fun racing and trying to score; - It has active developers; - New updates (like cars, maps and gamemodes) released every now and then; - Not paid-to-win.  Cons: None.   Long review:  When this game was first released, I purchased it before the hypetrain took Rocket League to the next level. Back then, it only had the standard gamemode and a number of cars. The developers quickly released some patches for bugs that needed fixing, but it was a very well made game upon release.  The DLCs released by Psyonix are definitely worth their money if you're interested in new car models, wheels, boost designs, etc. No DLC is paid-to-win, and microtransactions have only been introduced recently: crates and keys containing more visual items, there are no paid-to-win items at all, so that's a big plus.  As for the gamemodes, it started with a pretty simple arena and you just had to score. Soon after they released the hockey gamemode, where the ball was turned into a puck which actually behaved like one. After that they released the hoops gamemode, which is similar to basketball. You have hoops which are elevated, and you score by making the ball go through the hoop from above (it doesn't work from below, I've tried).   Just recently they released the rumble gamemode, in this gamemode you play in a random arena (from the default gamemode) and you get random powerups every 10 seconds. To get a new powerup, you have to use your current one and wait for 10 seconds. Powerups can include teleportation (you vs. an opposing player), force boost on an opposing player, a magnet which attracts the ball towards you from a certain, short, distance and a lot more. It's quite fun and refreshing.  Other than the abovelisted gamemodes, you have regular and ranked gameplay. Both try to match you with players of your skill level as best as they can, and they quite often do a good job of doing so.   This game is definitely recommended, because at first I did not think I would be playing this game as much as I do.

This game is extremely fun to play with or without friends. It has the most staggering experience progression I have ever seen. Playing in the beginning, you wait for the ball to come to you; gradually you start being able to go for the ball earlier, earlier, son you're flying! You're able to predict where the ball will go. You're able to predict where other players will hit it. You're able to coordinate with a team and adapt to either offensice or defensive.  It's extremely team-based... it's soccer after all! Pay attention to the ball's next destination and always anticipate a pass from a teammate. You'll meet people who are very good at the game, and you'll make great friends through it. Whether you play duels, doubles, standard, or anything else, you will have a blast alone or with buddies.  Get it! You have nothing to lose! Rocket League is a great game with three modes. In Player vs AI mode, you compete against up to seven opponents to try to stop your computer-controlled teammates from driving the ball all the way from the enemy goal line straight into your own goal.
