While I love this game I cannot recommend it to anyone to spend their hard-earned money on. It has been slowly going down the wrong path with the addition of crates, the Rumble game type, and AquaDome. The addition of the AquaDome arena is the main driver for this negative review. My laptop (see specs below) is under spec and I get that but have been able to happily play many hours with low quality graphics and get a very playable 30 fps. Then they added AquaDome. I get a very choppy, laggy 10 fps and have to account for a 1 or 2 second delay. Now this was never a problem until this arena and it is negatively influencing my ranking. Every time I play in that arena in a ranked match my team loses because I cannot contribute. Once again, I understand that I am below spec but with the direction this game is going, it will make it unplayable on a wide range of computers and that's a shame to see. I try my hardest to avoid that one arena but that's impossible in ranked matches. Before you consider buying this game ensure that you have at least the minimum specs listed, otherwise your gameplay experience will be less than satisfactory with new features.   Specs:  Operating System: Microsoft Windows 10 Home DirectX* Version: 11.0 Physical Memory: 6050 MB Processor: Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-2450M CPU @ 2.50GHz Processor Speed: 2494 MHz Graphics in Use: Intel(R) HD Graphics 3000 VRAM: 848 MB

This game is AMAZING!!!!!! There was some turbulence at launch, but the servers are up and running decent now. I have a feeling this is going to be a BIG game and have some energetic competitive leagues. As you may have heard the servers where down on launch for an extended period of time (about a day i think). i used this time to get good at goalie and unlock some intresting hats while some in the community cried for a refund. i hope they got it because this community doesnt need thier negativity and they are much more welcome elsewhere.  Here are the pros/cons from what I've seen. Pros: - Fun Physics. - Crazy rocket powerd arial moves. - Multiple cars all with different hit boxes. - AI on All-star mode are crazy good and pro can be a challenge too. - Positive community from what I've seen. - Tons of customizations. - The teams in season mode differ in skill so your not just playing the same team over and over  ( EX: one team is 11-1 and another could be 3-8, you will end up playing both). - The developers are transparent and hard working, pretty sure none of them slept trying to get the servers up. Check thier twitters tweets and responses if you dont belive me lol. - Decent player base.  Cons: - Occasional lag spike (servers are still new and under massive stress, this will obviously improve with time).    TLDR; Buy it, its worth the $20 unless you're a PS+ member (its free for them) Also if your wondering if you can play with keyboard and mouse, it works fine.

Game in all honesty is fun and cooperative; however from time to time a added report and kicking feature would be appreciated. Mose players respect others and play fairly and apologize and then are accepted by their teamates for mishaps. In some cases though I have witnessed players become harrassed and antagonized by others who play in the game with them. Oftenly disabling of chat and muting sometimes is not enough. Oftenly my friends and aquaintences say that they are often messaged after games with horrid comments from said 'evil', 'unfriendly', 'uncooperative' players. Yes kicking features should be deemed from a concept of excessive comments that are profane rude or offensive to others. Also a in favor rule of team members wanting to remove players from their team must be considered in a vote as much as penalty functions against the opposing team. Perhaps maybe a inclusion to where opposite teams with 'evil' players may prohibit those players from aquiring the needs to destroy other players vehicles. These features need to be added in for the reinstitution of old players who had left and give more reason for new players to join.

After having several hours of playtime with lots more to come, I have come up with a list of pros, cons, and future update ideas for this amazing game...  Pros: - Endless hours of fun - Unlockable vehicles, designs, materials, and hats - Casual and ranked mode - Addictive gameplay - Awesome soundtrack - Multiplayer up to 8 - Splitscreen :O - Ps4 and Pc crossover - Controller support - Achievements  Cons: - Only one gamemode (Probably more coming soon) <-- since this review, they have fixed this  Need To Add: - More gamemodes - Money system? - Abilities? - Pre-game positioning - Vehicle stats (Some vehicles are better at certain positions) - Skill trees? (This would be asking for too much probably)   Overall this is a very exciting, extremely well made, fast and fun game!  9.5/10 (Until they add a few gamemodes)

Devs have decided to remove the Rocket Labs playlist, where all the weird 'test' maps were, and force them into the regular game mode, where in my opinion they don't belong at all. I accepted the previous few maps without making a fuss since they were fairly vanilla all things considered, but deciding to dump all the extreme test maps in classic mode despite knowing full well the negative reaction it would bring feels like a massive middle finger on their part.  Players have asked countless times for the option to choose what maps they want to play on, a feature which would make everyone happy with no negative effects whatsoever, but the devs still didn't give us anything besides a likes and dislikes system, which doesn't prevent unwanted maps from showing up anyways.  As fun as the game can be when not thrown into horribly bad maps, until they give players the freedom of choice i will not recommend it to anyone, and i hope a thumbs down will be a more effective way to get devs to listen to the negative feedback than posts on a forum which they don't seem to read.

tl;dr version:  Very good basic game, but still lacking a lot of polish and features. Feels a bit EA, still, in that regard. Recommendable for private play, where it plays out as fun as any multiplayer arena game- but absolutely not recommendable for public play, where frequent server issues, an overwhelmingly toxic and exploitative community, numerous unresolved bugs and design flaws, and lousy matchmaking all make for a game that is more often than not very disagreeable to play.  ~ ~ ~  Great game, offering a blend of childhood marbles like physics fun, racing hijinks, soccer gameplay, and even arena brawling. It's a game that's inherently easy to pick up, play, and enjoy, and really, plays just the way you'd expect it to from the videos and screenshots, no disappointments in that regard. So really, if it looks at all interesting to you, you should pick it up!   ..wait, or not.   For a good while now, there've been some significant issues in the game that the developers have failed to address in any way, and it mars an otherwise solid game.  * Horribly toxic community, seemingly no oversight by the devs in that regard. You can mute the players for that single match, but it doesn't carry over to any other match, or prevent regrouping with them. It also doesn't address other abusive gameplay elements- idling (for drops) is a key example, being so common that you're bound to bump into it after just a couple of runs (and during the holiday events, expect this to be nearly every run) There are a lot of amazingly capable and fun and positive players in this game, and if the developers approached things with any degree of oversight, this might actually be one of the better communities in an online game. Unfortunately, as with any MMO where toxic individuals understand that there are no punishments for acting out, what should be a minor occurance has wildfired.  Doesn't help that the report function no longer allows you to report users once they leave a match, so you'll sometimes get people deliberately sabotaging their team, spewing a bunch of curses, and then ragequitting. On the other hand, when I've discussed reporting users to other players, the positive-minded players gave a clear impression of 'it's useless, the devs won't do anything' while the negative-minded ones laughed and- well, said the same thing. So that's clearly the biggest issue of it all.  * Input recognition failures, flip recognition failures, ability activation failures, contact recognition glitches- most of these issues can be explained by server issues that've persisted (and in many ways, only grown worse) since the Rumble release some time back. But they're common, and they're going to bite you in the ♥♥♥ at least a couple of times each match, most matches. Some matches are completely unplayable because of these issues.   * Joining in-progress matches doesn't prevent you from rejoining a match you left (due to toxic players), and despite a recent patch, still spawns you in at very disadvantageous circumstances, often leading you to run right into the ball upon spawn, sending it as-often-as-not into your own goal.   * Rumble mode is unpolished, with several minor quirks. Most notably, the inability to properly target with targeted abilities and their often switching targets as you activate them, can cause you to inadverently help your opponents, rather than hinder them.   * General modes don't use any sort of ranking system to make sure you get decent matches, or even matches to your skill level, so it's always a complete crapshoot to lobby up. On the other hand, ranked modes are based on the (in my opinion) very subpar 3v3 mode (if that was all the game had, I wouldn't actually recommend it- due to the size of most of the arenas, and the sometimes glitchy physics, it's too easy in standard 3v3 to get a lucky shot into a goal).   Mind you, this isn't really a flaw with 3v3 itself, but with the maps used for 3v3 (which are typically better designed for 4v4). Hoops, the basketball mode, also suffers from being better suited for 3v3 play (and a slightly larger map) than for 2v2. Meanwhile, on the opposite side of things, Hockey (3v3) lacks the physics glitches of normal 3v3, due to its hockey-puck shaped ball, and works fabulously in 3v3. Rumble (the mode with activatable abilities) is crazy enough to get by in 3v3 as well, and Chaos (4v4) is the ideal team play mode, working far better with most maps than 3v3 does.  So, the option is to play standard ranked (which you can't easily leave without closing client the way- which in a way is understandable, but also makes bad public groupings all the more painful. Definitely do ranked with a team of players you're comfortable with, rather than public grouping it.), or to play unranked matches with no meaningful matchmaking system at all, but far better mechanics and balancing.  At least from my perspective and preferences, the game is lacking a lot of polish.  * Outside of holiday drops, and the game's premium chests, cosmetic drops appear to have been reduced to very rare drop rates along with the Rumble update a while back. If you enjoy unlocking cosmetics (and in this game, you can trade in sets of 5 cosmetics for a random cosmetic of one higher rarity tier, so it's rather enjoyable) expect that appeal to be rarely encountered. On the other hand, chests seem plentiful enough, so if you're into purchasing your cosmetics, hey, the devs would be glad for your funds. Which, y'know, isn't so bad- except all the premium cosmetics are the most gaudy, shiny, flashy things the devs can come up with. If you want anything that's actually stylish, coordinated, subdued, subtle, or otherwise not mid-life-crisis or teenager-making-a-statement, then you'll need to grind those non-premium drops to get something appealing.     The game is fantastic, no doubt. And when you get good pairings, it's a calculated sports game, with all the appeal of a racing game throwin in, with fabulous teamwork potential. Other than the above issues, and still lacking a bit of variety in modes and maps, the game is thoroughly solid.  So I'll gladly swap this to a positive review in an instant- as soon as the devs at least give firm indication that they care about the general gameplay of the game as much as they do their premium leagues.  That's not me being petty with my review, but a simple fact to the rating system Steam uses: While I can definitely say I enjoy this game, I can't at all say I  recommend  it in its current state. There's just too much frustration in it.  Then again, if you avoid the public gameplay altogether, and just play on teams fully crewed by friends? If you view this as that kind of game, rather than as a public MMO, then by all means, this game is recommendable.  In fact, inherently I'd put this among the topmost games in both sports and arena brawlers, comparable to any of the best ones out there (except for the lack of polish in some areas, and with having less scale than most sports games, and having less variety of content than most arena brawlers).  If you're intending this for play with friends, either in closed groups or in a ranked team, then I highly recommend giving this game a go. If you're in for the public gameplay aspect, then it all boils down to how easily you're frustrated by toxic MMO communities and bad servers, compounded with other minor stresses.  Personally, I end up leaving one play session out of four deeply satisfied- and the remaining three stressed and exhausted, from a game that was meant to relax me.

With a bad ranking system, expensive price, and the fact that it doesn't take very long to get old and repetetive, I chose to write a negative review for this game.  BEFORE YOU READ:  I like this game, but to me the negatives outweigh the positives. Its a cool idea, it really is. The execution is where I have quite a few problems. I could have easily written a positive review for this game, but I didn't choose to do so.  POSITIVES:  - Decent graphics - Lots of cosmetics - Not any noticable bugs  NEGATIVES:  - Gets old very fast with few gametypes - Cross-Platform, so instantly PC players are better due to inferior console controls - Ranking system that relies more on levels than ranks - Expensive Price (20$, which is pretty ambiguous coming from a indie company and a steam game...) - SAME FREAKING SONG EVERY TIME YOU OPEN THE GAME (jk I still love you...)  OVERALL:  This game tries to be competetive, which is where it fails most. I'd say at the least its a fun casual game, but personally I don't think I could ever get into this game like I do with games like CS:GO or Overwatch. Decent title, but far too overpriced as mentioned before. All in all, buy it on sale and have a fun night with your friends, but don't expect to dedicate all of your time to it since it gets bland fast.

I bought this for 11.69€ from Bundle Stars, cause my friends told me this was awesome... It cost a lot for me so I hoped this was good. I regreted my purchase...  It was developed on Unreal Engine 3, which is alright. It looks good (except for the wierd fov rendering), physics are alright and so on... Fun concept, design of the cars...  Now for the problems. First off, this costs 20€. If you going to sell something like that expensive, you need content, you need replayability. All maps are the same except fom really minor changes, only one playable mode (you do have sort of campaign with SEASONS but you will beat the AI everytime). And what about the content? Do you unlock every car by leveling up (not sure why there is there a leveling system)? 'What?, No? DLC CARS? FOR 1.99€ A CAR? OR 3.99 FOR 2 CARS?' Now its NOT a pay-to-win situation because all cars have same stats. But why am I paying 20€ for locked off content, which is already in game? Do I really need to pay 64.85€ to have content? Are you serious? The basic version has barely content for 7,50€ game... If it was a free title then sure, but NEVER HAVE THIS KIND OF DLC IN A PAID GAME!  Oh and there are crates... with keys you need to buy to unlock them... like CS:GO...  Players are not worikng as a team. In a team-based game. All they want are goals, and they hate you if you take it from them.  Hate this review all you want, its not even going to lower the overall review stats anyway. People must be blind that they dont realize, they are spending alot of money by paying for these DLCs.  Conclusion? I do enjoy playing this from time to time, but I never should have bought this for 11.69€, no content... and the music is not good...

I like to call this game 'Football with cars' thats because its all it is (I don't give a ♥♥♥♥ about the basketball update).  Here are some positives: -The car customizations are pretty sweet and the maps are great too. -I like how the party system and the practice works in this game. -The graphics are pretty neat and the game is also able to run pretty smooth on a low end computer like mine.  Here is what ruined it for me: -The idea of football with cars sounds great on paper but in practice its unplayable (although I have to give them credit for the neat controls, at least it isn't as hard as playing football with cars would be in real life) the in-air controls could have used some work though (with that note pretty much the funnest thing to do in this game is ramming your opponents).  So thats pretty much it, I would tell you to play a different video game with football (or basketball, gahd what ever) instead of this but then again in my opinion they are all ♥♥♥♥ and you should just play those sports in real life (if you can't then I am sorry but you will never truly enjoy it... EVER!). This game is pretty over hyped just like CS:GO, League of Legends, Dota 2, Rust, Ark, and others that have not come out yet or I havent heard of.  P.S. you should also remember that this is my peorsonal opinion of the game from my (1 hour) experience with the game, if you enjoy it then good for you, go play it

Rocket League, a game which had dashed in the right direction but which lost its spirit of game with the updates: - Random system of earnings of rank/division in the classified matches (why do you have removed the points system?), - Abolition of the public server 'Snow Day' (we must create a private server without password hoping that players come with you to play on this game mode)  - system of 'mute/report' which stirs up controversy in view of its excessive use by players who don't support the defeat (in classified match or not)  - orientation of the game towards a professional world (e-sport competition), goodbye the good-natured spirit  I regret having invested in their DLC to end in this result now. The mentality of a lot of players aims towards what know games such as League of Legends (very heavy be offended 3 times on 4 during matches solo when we score a point or to be decreased when the opponent scores a point).  =========  Rocket League, un jeu qui s'était lancé dans la bonne direction mais qui a perdu son esprit de jeu au fil des mises à jour :  - système aléatoire de gain de 'rang'/division dans les classés (pourquoi avoir retiré le système de points ?),  - suppression du serveur public 'Snow Day / Jour de Glace' (obligé de créer un serveur privé sans mot de passe en espérant que des joueurs viennent avec vous pour jouer sur ce mode de jeu) - système de 'mute/report' (couper le micro / reporter un mauvais comportement) qui fait polémique au vue de son utilisation abusive par des joueurs qui ne supportent pas la défaite (que ça soit en match classé ou non) - orientation du jeu vers un monde professionnel (compétition e-sport), au revoir l'esprit bon enfant  Je regrette d'avoir investi dans leurs DLC pour aboutir à ce résultat actuellement. La mentalité de bon nombre de joueurs tend vers ce que connaissent les jeux comme League of Legends ( très lourd de se faire insulter 3 fois sur 4 durant des matchs solo quand on marque un point ou de se faire rabaisser quand l'adversaire marque un point).

What can I say. The game has great graphics, good core gameplay, a sound concept and a good execution. It's a good game, or so you think.  It is the only game that makes me want to throw my PC out of a window and jump on it until there's nothing left.  There are three ways to play the game, with AI which only understands the ability to chase a ball and jump and hit it, with local players on splitscreen which leads to graphic glitches and with humans on PC or PS4 online.  The AI, as I've said, is thicker than the earth's mantle layer and will own goal at will. Because the matchmaking is horrific since the addition of the option to disable cross-play, finding someone to fill in the places on a doubles, standard or chaos match will be impossible forcing you to team up with the AI. While I'm there, the option to disable cross-play has lead to the ghettoisation of the online servers. While originally there were plenty of servers will many people available to play, once you get to a server with no PC team mate, you're stuck there for good.  Fun fact, I once waited half an hour in the pre-match waiting screen with no one else because the matchmaking is broken.  That's before I get to humans! The player base is the most vitriolic, toxic player base I've ever come across, and I used to play games on the Xbox 360 system! You make a mistake such as timing your move wrong, or you misjudge where the ball lands and you're branded as 'noob', 'f***tard', 'easy' or something else. And if you're lucky enough to have a human team 'mate', they'll brand you with just the same amount of silly vitriol, perhaps more.  The game servers are better than they used to be, but are still horrific. You could be stable at 40-50 ping then suddenly because someone else on the same broadband internet connection opens up a web page you go to 800 ping and start rubber-banding more than flubber. Not everyone has Fibre To The Property broadband and lives in the likes of London, New York, San Francisco, Singapore, Paris, Berlin or wherever the fastest internet connections are.  If I have fun, it's for a handful of minutes, then at that stage, it's gone and I feel like I need to start hitting someone.  This game was made for E-Sports, but I hate the concept of E-Sports. There's no sportsmanship, there's no fun, it's serious twitch reactions, something that video games seriously need to excise.

This is my personal opinion mixed with a bit of fact. The game is difficult, for sure. I don't know if it's just me, but control wise, it can be hard to get a handle on. I don't mind this too much, it just takes a long time to get used to. The thing that gets me about this game and the reason I don't play it, is the community and people who play it. I'm not too good at the game just about every game I play, that's all I hear. 'LOL LOOK AT THE SCORE, YOU GUYS SUCK ♥♥♥♥' and the likes, as if it's a bunch of CoD 12 year olds. That being said, I simply don't play the game anymore. It's not because I 'can't take an insult', but more so that I don't like playing with immature kids. Not to mention that the DLC cars have better hit boxes or some ♥♥♥♥ like that.  To be quite honest, this game is like poker. Based off of luck, it seems. Especially with your connection. If you don't have tard low ping, you're pretty much screwed, so keep that in mind if you wish to purchase this game.  Additionally, the ranking system is terrible. Maybe this is what causes my troubles, but from my first online match, I was up against Veterans and not too long after, Experts. Sure, throw me into the fray to learn, but I get fed up with constantly being rolled and don't have much of a chance to learn. I know this game is the buzz right now, but having given it multiple honest chances, I can safely say this is not for me. In my opinion the game gives for endless tedium cycles, lol-so-random terrible physics and wobbly quirky car collisions rather than what I'd imagine car soccer could be. The game's lack of offsides, horrendous jump mechanic and the ball's martian gravity like behavior give for more frustrating moments, with tiny bits of fun spread out few and far apart.  All in all, greatly underwhelming, but moreso, incredibly frustrating and borderline playable.

The physics of the game are cool.  The waste of space teammates are not and I don't want to play 1v1.  I either get teammates who sit in the net the entire game, wasting a spot on my team, unable to block any shots that comes at them... or teammates who spend more time ramming me than the ball, leaving the 2 of us halfway up a wall while the other team takes the ball to score.  I just don't understand why there isn't like a common knowledge training session for this, or just give us a mode with 10v10 so it's as ridiculous as it honestly already is.  *Edited Review for the Rocket League fanboy who got butthurt over it in comments. This review IS about ranked play and there is NOTHING else to review about this game. You drive and jump while chasing a ball. It's fun for an hour but you're going to get annoyed with your teammates because that's how gaming goes in 2016.

This is utterly broken. It's crap. Don't buy it.  So, this game got a lot of attention and yeah, everyone needs it? No. My bias upfront: I hate football (or soccer, if you're from _that_ country) and suck at driving games. So I was really quite certain that this game isn't for me, but a nice YT guy convinced me that it might be fun, if played with the right crowd.  That's the problem: The online sessions are broken. I have a play time of around 4h (more than 50% of that was incidently the game sitting idle in the menues, while I tended to my kids I guess. Steam refunds are only possible within the first two hours. Oh my...).  A normal session, limited to Europe as region, looks like this:  - Wait - Wait some more, because only 4 out of 6 show up - Wait times out, 2 bots join - Those bots score more than everyone else and do insane stuff  Yay. The AI is good. That isn't fun, though. It's rare to have a full human match and the difference in skill level - at my level - is too big. AI = Amazing, Everyone else is .. somewhere between incompetent and somewhat capable (I'm heavily leaning towards incompenent myself).  If you ignore that there are no (full) games: Even a mediocre difference in ping leads to a completely broken game experience. Mine is usually around 20, if some of the rare humans in a match have something around 90-100 the game is unplayable. The ball jumps back and forth, travels back in time and the game is - there is no other word - broken beyond repair.  Combine this: 'Not enough human players' with 'Enough latency and the game is unplayable' and .. well - fun, right?  I regret every cent I payed for this game. It's not only bad, it's the worst game for me this year and I don't recall a worse game from 2014. I wanted to exercise the 'Refund' option for the first time in my loooooong Steam history, for this very game. Unfortunately - as described above - sitting idle in the menus is 'playing the game' for Steam, so yeah, I totally 'played' this game for 4h so far and therefor cannot get my money back.  The least I can do is to state here that - The game is utterly broken - I advise you not to buy this game - You should - if you ignored the first two bullet points - give it 90min to confirm my complaints and instantly ask for a refund  Blech.

This game has a simple premise, and a simple goal! Score! Put the ball in the opponents net! IT Couldnt get any simpler! Its Football with cars! And for the first hour it was fun! The tutorial eased me into the game nicely, yet I felt the game could still offer me a great challenge beyond learning the basics. The graphics the games stability (baring match making) were all admirable.  My first Online match couldnt have gone better, I sunk 2 in the net and the team went on to win 5 - 2. Great I thought, thourougly enjoyed. However an hour later, and honestly, I was bored! The more matches I played the more I realised that this is just a physics based pot luck game. Every match was essentially 8 cars throwing themselves at this giant ball, hoping to either get the ball into the opponents half or score! And thats IT! Theirs literally nothing else to the game! Yes you can customise your cars etc! But the cars arnt that detailed, theirs no difference between them other than shape/looks. A van type car you would think would be purposed more towards defence vs the sportier sleeker cars etc, but No! Each car is identical, so what happens online is nothing short of 5 mins of manic chasing this giant ball. Getting bashed around left right and centre by not only the opposition, but equally by your team mates.   I keep seeing people saying the game has multiple layers of depth, and you can tell the skilled vs the none skilled players etc. Guess what? My team of all noob Rookie labelled players, just beat an entire team of Semi-Pros 6 - 2. Did we play well! NOPE, we just launched oursleves at the ball blindly and hoped for the best! The hitboxes on the cars are sketchy at best. On countless occassions I slowed down and methodically hit the ball from a certain angle i.e. left or right. Only to have the ball bounce straight up in the opposite direction!? I've scored from one end of the pitch to the other, even though the ball was actually put in the net by the opposite team, trying to clear it from the goal! Apparently this game has no concept of HOME goals!  I've watched numerous Twitch games streamed, and I'm sorry! I am yet to be convinced their is anything skilled about this game! Yes I have seen some fancy goals scored on YouTube etc, and people stating thats the difference between a skilled and non skilled player etc. Equally! If probably not more so, I have seen many incredible goals scored completely without intention or knowledge of the player who scored them, i.e. blind luck (or dodgy physics engine!).   This game to me was a 5min pick up and play game with friends on a Friday night, nothing more! The hype and reviews on this game at the moment I just dont understand! Its football with cars, without the complexities or intricacies of the beautiful game. Just be careful when you buy!  Watch a few videos, ignore the web reviews, just watch! Then make your decision! This is by no means a bad game by any shout! In fact I'd probably give it a 7/10, its a quick and easy to get into pick up and play game! Just beware of the hype machine on this one.

I was hesitant to buy the game at 20 bucks but eventually decided I would give it a try. Now that I'm more than 550 hours in, and currently in the top division, I can definitely say that the game is worth it.   It's great as a party/nooby game as its fun to pick up even when you aren't too good. And as the game is essentially entirely skill based, there is a ton of room for growth and too see yourself improve.  Added bonus: Psyonix is awesome when it comes to communicating with the community. Also relative to other popular games, and especially the higher up u get, there is not very much toxicity. Not to say that there aren't people that just blame others and rage, cause there are, but relatively speaking, there are less.  If you have your doubts just watch a few ESL games, or check out the following: Youtube: Amoney_tv, Gibbs, subparbutinhd, kronovi, paschy90, lachinio, low5ive Twitch: xRizzo00, Amoney_tv, low5ive  Just buy it!!!

This is an incredibly good game!  The developers are amazing. There are some problems with the servers, as the game became a lot more popular, than the developers had expected. They constantly write updates on their twitter, and talk to the community.  The game is cross-platform with the PS4, but as of yet you cannot create a party cross-platform, because Sony/Steam's rules doesn't allow it. The developers have said that they are working on a solution to bypass that.  The game is extremely fun and really addicting. The graphics are beautiful, and there is a lot of collectibles.  If you are planning to play this game, you should play it with a controller. The game is just a lot better with a controller.  It is the best game I have played this year!

This is a tough one to review, but made harder by Steams stupid rating system of Yes or No.  The game is superb, fun, beautiful and addictive.  The issue is that since launch the servers have been a nightmare, game breaking lag, downtime, turn off social features and more.  We've seen no progress on fixing it, just a post in the forum that claims they are fixing the issue but weeks later, nothing has improved.  The game is now festering on the installed games list, but now never played because of the unplayable lag.  You think your driving at the ball, then you go to hit the ball and you realised the ball is actually at the other end of the pitch. You turn you car right and it jumps 10 feet to the right and then fires you forward across the pitch, to only then fire you back to where you started.  Right now, don't waste your money, monitor the forums and wait for evidence that this games servers have been fixed.

If you're willing to buy this game, read this.  - The servers totally suck, spike and lag everytime, and sometimes they just get offline for no reason, 1 hour, 2 hour, 3 hours, we never know when its coming back. - The ranked system completely sucks, the 2x2 mode theres only people playing with friends, if you're going to play alone, you will get a huge disadvantage against people playing in party, the 3x3 and 1x1 are the only modes that you can get some fun without playing with people in party, but in my opinion, the 2x2 is the best way to play, and I just cant play it, because in 90% of the cases i get people in party on the other team, they created a standart 3x3, for 3 people play in party, but instead of creating a mode like in League of Legends where people in party will ever play with people in party, that doesn't happen, in standart 3x3 mode you cant get 3 people party against 3 random persons, which is pretty unfair. - Ranked system points: ♥♥♥♥, it sucks too much, when you win a match, you get something like 7~10 points (if someone quits, you get something like 1~5 points, yes, people usually quit when they're losting, the ban system is 15 minutes with 'find match' locked, thats basically nothing), when you lost you just get the same amount, you need to win a lot of matchs in a row if you want to climb up, what is not easy in 3x3 mode, the individual skill of the player doesn't matter too much. - The userbase; Jesus christ, the userbase of this game is something really bizarre, it's full of kids and ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s, flame, leaving and idiot people saying ♥♥♥♥ on the mic is something constant in this game, so if you're thinking you're going to play with mature or normal people, you're not getting this.  The pro of this game is that beside of all that I said, the game is cool, it's good to pass your time, but if you're willing to play ranked and climb up, you're going to face a hard road.

It does get repetitive but the 4 different modes, of which change the amount of players, affects the gameplay immensely. 1 vs 1 is more methodical where 4 vs 4 (aptly named “Chaos”) is just endless bumping and boosting.  If you want a game you can easily pick up and play any time of day for 5 minutes or for 5 hours, then get this game.  Killjoys need not apply.

I've only recently been drawn into Rocket League, mostly because it was on sale and I have a vague notion of it's popularity. At first I couldn't help but think this is as boring as real soccer a game where, 'Twenty-two men chase a ball for 90 minutes and at the end, the Germans always win' (too soon Brazil?). It's just a bunch of toy cars chasing an incredulously oversized ball against vividly colored if remarkably uninspired landscapes (Thunderdome, Steampunk, Toadstool castle courtyard?), but the more I was dragged into matches by my friends who loved the game, the more I saw the appeal. It's a massive mess of a game, playing with people like me who don't know what we're doing, and then the artful masters of the game who set up their own goals with careful dribbling and ball play (If you know what I mean...). Rocket League becomes not just a mad free-for-all, but a game of comradery, hard losses, daring comebacks, and the edge of your seat intensity of... well, being a real soccer fan.

The game is a ton of fun. I gve it a 8/10 for competitive match type games.   There are two things I would change though. This is just my personal opinion but I think it would make the game much better for all.  First I would take out the ability to 'fly'. I get it, it's pretty, and it does take some skill to do, but the problem is there are a lot of players who prefer keyboard and mouse, like myself. Using this ability is much harder on keyboard and mouse than it is on controller, giving those using controller and proficient with it an advantage. Just a thought, I think it's not really needed in a futbol game.  Then I would make demolition 'kills' last longer. Not too long, but right now there is no real benefit to demolishing an opponent, they spawn rather quickly and of no consequence. Either don't allow it or make it have some kind of consequence, make players have to keep their eye open for possible incoming in hopes of avoiding it. The only time it really benefits you is when you hit the goalie and the ball is already right on their goal.  Otherwise a super fun game. So far I've only played a few hours of it. Mostly playing Ranked right now, reached Silver so far in standard 3v3. I definitely reccomend it even with the things I would change.

Rocket League is pure fun. I've had a few friends of mine start playing it since my purchase and I always say the same thing... 'everyone is terrible at this game'. While this is mostly true, especially when you first start playing, you will occassionally encounter some incredibly skilled players who are flying around the arena a hitting the ball from heights that you hope to one day emulate.  The available game modes carry some minimal variety to the format to keep things fresh, but when the mechanics feel this responsive you canm spend many hours in one mode playing match after match.  I believe my feelings toward this game are best highlighted by the fact that after I played this game for many hours on the Playstationm 4 I did not hesitate to double dip on my purchase and buy it again once I found out a different group of my friends was playing on PC.  Rocket League is arguably the best game of 2015 because it is nothing but pure fun to play!

This game brings back those feels and is perfect whether you're looking for a progressive challenge or just a time-waster, as the games are five minutes (regulation) in length. This game leaves a lot of room for strategic planning and tactical experimentation as well as honing your visuospatial prediction skills. This game is fast-paced, hectic and rewards teamwork (if you can manage to get someone to cooperate).

Rocket League is one of those games that's easy to learn, but difficult to master. You're basically using RC cars to play soccer. But the rules about dangerous play go out the window as you can demolish other cars, knock each other out of the way when making a play, and also drive up onto the stadium wall to make a perfect aerial shot into the goal. On the surface, the game is easy, but with difficult advanced mechanics, you could spend hours just practicing aerials alone and still miss the ball a lot. Group up with some friends for some 2v2, 3v3, or 4v4 action that just gets even more awesome when you play as a team. With lots of free content already included and some paid DLC on the way, Rocket League promises more fun to come in the forseeable future!

Grab some friends, or don't and just play this brilliant and fun game. The objective is simple get the ball in to the opponents goal using your car and stop them from getting the ball in to your goal.  Anything goes and almost always does in a round of chaos. Ram your opponents at full speed to destroy them and get yourself some extra points, fly through the air like a clumsy jet powered moose and score the most flashy goal that you can. Then watch the replay of that goal, never skip!!  Save your greatest games and most ludicrous saves in a full match replay so that you can watch it again and again from different angles.  Hate football LOVE Rocket League!

I have 255 hours invested in this game. I've bought one DLC (Revenge of the Battle-Cars). 50% of the time when you join a ranked game and the other team makes the first goal, you'll find your teammate will either attempt to forfeit, leave, or just drive around the map like a ♥♥♥♥ (give up). 40% of the time you will be partnered up with someone who respects the game and plays very well, but you'll find the opposing team is exponentially better or worse than you. The other 10% of the time, both teams are equally matched and each player makes a fair amount of goals, blocks, passes, etc. You all have a grand time.  The (roughly) 25 hours I've spent in fair games have been amazingly fun. I've met a few friends, learned how to better myself on the field, and come to hate the other 90% even more. And I would highly recommend this game because of that 10%.  (The reason I'm typing this is because I can't join another game for 15 minutes because I decided to leave a game due to my partner who belongs to the 50%. Otherwise I wouldn't bother.)

This review is a comparison from the previous game.  i've played super rocket powered acrobatic battle cars (long name) and loved it.  This game however improved a lot in diferent aspects:  - one of the most funniest games in steam  - AL bots are better: they now can enter in online games, no more handicap games (they can score amazing goals against noobs).  - Customize: i like the ideia to create your own car  - You dont need controller to play this, keyboard is fine, i do hat tricks all the time believe me  (but if u want to do some serious gaming i recommend it)  - Dont waste time, u can do stuff while waiting for a match.   Unfortunately theres cons, they removed some great stuff from SRPABC, but can be patched:  - No Auto-goals (theres lots of people who deserve humilation award )   - Reward medals at the end of each game. The only award avaible is the MVP award  they removed best wingman, goal keeper , and more... (its always good to have a shelf full of awards) medals can improve moral and performance. its scietific fact   - All the maps have the same format, the previous game had funny maps. i would like to see this in a patch some day but i dont know if its possible. the old maps are great.   i think its all i dont remember any more details, have fun.

TLDR at bottom  I'm gonna start by saying this is the first review i've ever written.  I always considered myself an arpg/story driven rpg kind of guy. I have played some cod in the past, but the raging got worse and worse ( yes im that kind of person when other human players are involved sadly). I have dabbled a bit in LoL and Smite, same problem.    I Don't know what got into me to buy and try out RL, maybe a combination of boredom and to see what all the fuzz was about. I have several friends who play and praise it.   Like in the other games i mentioned at start it was very new and very fun, after a while i could hit the ball with some consistency and even get it to go in the general direction i was aiming for ! damn this is fun !  After about 40hours of unranked play i felt ready to tackle the lower divisions in ranked! getting out of unranked went pretty fast, and got me more motivated, prospects 1 just a tad ittle slower but also pretty fast. prospects 2 gave me some bloodboiling moments but after a few hours i got out of that too. then came prospects 3, my first wall in the game. As i got better ( so i thought ) Bad play from my teammates could really get on my nerves, here came my first few rage quits. As with cod, lol and smite, the same thing was happening again... I was blaming my 'noob' teammates i got paired with for holding me back. But then something happened that never happened before: Somehow this game made me TRULY realize that if i couldn't get higher ME, MYSELF and I needed to get better. and so i did. for half a day i practiced my saves and aerials in training mode, for another half day i only played unranked to practice my newfound skills. Then i tried ranked again, and got to prospects elite pretty quikly. This where i am now and i think this is another wall, but that's ok now, i'm not feeling mad anymore. offcourse there are still alot of moment i'm cringing a little inside but i can control the rage. There has never been a game where i could do that.  oh and i have the game 7 days now and played around 60 hours now i think. the no-life is real! also something that hasn't happend for some time now :)  TLDR  As many have said, it's a great game in my opinion. so i'm not gonna say the same stuff others have said. WHat i do like to point out is this.  Are you a rage quiter in pvp games ? can you almost throw your pc out of the window with those kind of games ? Because you get paired with noobs all the time ? Try out this game, it might be the game to cure your rage ;)

Really fun game!!! Customizable Vehicles Fast paced full contact sport! - has that NHL feel if you have a party! RC Rocket Powered Soccer/Football at its finest, this game is loved by all age groups :D  Some people complain that it's a little difficult to get the hang of, but i assure you, just some time practicing and you'll be surprising yourself, laughing, scoring, blowing cars up, flying accross the Dome-Stadium and bicycle kicking your way to the TOP!  suggest this to every one and everyone!  there is currently only ONE flaw with this game. The party system. You can have a party, but you can only play ranked with 1 other person for 2v2's. The only other ranked gametypes are for solo play, and they are 1v1-2v2-3v3 I believe they should allow parties to play anything from 2v2-4v4 RANKED. Exhibition can get pretty darn easy, so allowing the ranked increase will make this game 10x better  i have dual graphics, however i havnt had any issues with that. there is very minor server issues, but i really don't think it's the servers, i think it's the people Queing up. I've always been low ping in this game, however i see and vs people at like 160 ping constantly, and that creates skippy game play.

Quite possibly the most fun I've ever had with a video game. Some of us older folks remember an Unreal Tournament mod called Carball, and those of us who played that mod back in the day knew what a gem it was. Cars driving around hitting a ball into a goal, and dropping slime on one another and shooting rockets? What?  I never played or even heard of the successor that came to PS2 (or 3, whichever one it was), but when I heard about this game, I wondered if it was the same similar concept. Imagine my absolute and total joy when I realized it was the same thing (just sans the weapons)! I signed up for the Beta on PS4 and have logged hundreds and hundreds of hours ever since. I just can not adequately communicate or capture the value you get with your money on a game like this, and if you think you are a God at it, just please load up a Twitch stream of Kronovi (camgears) and then realize you have only just scratched the surface of what you can do in this game! And the real fun comes when you start mastering the deeper mechanics. Buy and enjoy.

Let's just say there's a good reason this game is always on the front page for 'Top Sellers' even without sales. Easy to 'pick up' impossible to master. Infinite skill cap matched with some of the best mechanics for team synergy that I have seen to date.  Devs who LISTEN. Seriously, go to the reddit and there are numerous stories of how bad ♥♥♥ these guys are. Drunk Girl being on the sound track was actually the result of some drunk dude emailing Psyonix about his unkown friend's song on soundcloud that he thought would really fit the game. Next thing you know it's one of the biggest songs on the soundtrack absolutely elevating this random artist's status. Not to mention how amazing all of the other songs are. Top notch music all around.  There were even several occasions where the dev interactions from the Rocket League reddit were posted on the No Man's Sky reddit causing a lot of those readers to fluctuate to Rocket League just based on how amazing these guys are.  These guys are a blessing for the video game industry and they made a damn fine game. Give them your support. Buy a four-pack for your friends. I swear you will get your money's worth plus more.

I honestly love this game to death, and I 100% recommend it. Where do I begin? Maybe it's because it has     Amazing graphics    High-quality gameplay    Fully Customizeable vehicles (for the most part)    Quality Dev Support and Updates (Unlike NMS which was a huge disappointment by the way)    HUGE player base    Multiplayer capabilites    And so much more that I'll leave considering purchasers to find out for themselves.   This game is a fantastic purchase, and in my opinion could   very likely   be sold for AAA price, instead of $20. I mean, with constant updates and developer support, it's well deserved (unlike NMS dear lord).  Rocket League is the type of game that you gives you some beginner's ground, but then leaves it up to you to become better as a player. The tutorial may not be the best, but it gives you a place to start, and then from there you can try the practices and become even better.   The controls are fully customizeable to suit one's playing style, and while I use the typical WASD (I actually use a Steam Controller) setup, it can be made for anyone.   The customizatiuon options are fantastic, althogh there are a couple of DLC cars (the Batmobile and the Back to the Future Time Machine) that don't offer more customization that just the color. But EVERY OTHER CAR alows you to fully customize it with wheels, decals, colors, antennas/flags, toppers, and boost trails.   The newly implemented trading system is very cool too; as you play online games you acquire customizeables and crates which you can trade with other players through an in-game trading system.   The soundtrack is amasing also, you can only listen to music in the main menu, sadly enough.   I know this isn't the best review, but I absolutely love this game, and it is one of the very few favorite games in my library. You honestly will not leave your house very often if you decide to make this purchase.

I'm a guy who absolutely hates sports. If you ask anyone I know a defining characteristic about my personality, there's a possibility that it is something they might mention. However, I absolutely love Rocket League. The physics and controls are a joy, and it's an immeasurable amount of fun running around trying to snag the ball away from my friends, whether it's through a fun power up or just a little ingenuity. I recommend this game for anyone, even if you're not a fan of sports. If you enjoy having a good time with your friends (or anyone via the game's online mode) and like being sneaky and strategizing in clever ways, this game is for you.

So far as game play is concerned everything is pitch perfect. Where other games rely on an arbitrary skill ceiling to maintain challenges Rocket League's skill ceiling is a variety of creativity, reaction time, tenacity, deceit, acrobatics, and more. There is truly depth to Rocket League and I can't say that about 80% of the games available today.   The purely aesthetic loot system is wonderful. It made taking the game too seriously difficult and subsequently the edgy bad manners players are less prevalent. Though now the loot system is starting too look all too familiar. Introducing a grinding component to acquiring loot as opposed to more liberally distributing loot. I suppose the hat on my car doesn't actually matter and they haven't touched the core game play but the intention behind implementing a more grind like loot system is step one in creating a market that threatens to consume the rest of the game. The moment options are taken away to stimulate more loot value that thumbs up is turning into a thumbs down and I'll write a new review from my adobe yurt in the Himalayas as the last thing I ever loved was gobbled up by laissez-faire capitalism.

Fast-paced and fun, ruins friendships faster than the enemy team can score.  *Edit* After playing it for a little longer here's my two cents:  - As always, very fast paced. Team mates vary from complete beginners to very good players. - Community may or may not be cancerous, but because communication is limited, it's not really an issue. - Pretty collors - DLCs are not a must but they're cheap and some of them are neat looking  *and another edit*  Yes, I do recommend this game because I friggin love the colors and stuff in it. I've nominated it even, but for my own category of what it is: It's unoriginal. It is a great game to play, with good physics and great to toy around. The idea is so simple it's brilliant. But there were many other games like it that didn't make it. This one did. Do I recommend it, though? Hell yes, it's fun to play. The Devs do a great job at what they do, and the eye candy is nice. There is only one aquatic map that gives my processor some trouble but other than that it's very well optimised. The customability in it is decent, I'd love to see no limitations as to what decals you can add on cars (there are vehicles that can not be customized with visual items from other vehicles). Other than that, it's fun as hell. Would recommend.  Overall, would recommend.

'Easy to learn, hard to master.' Most people who have played Rocket League would probably describe it this way. It's a game that most people will understand before ever starting to play. It's soccer (or hockey, thanks to newer playlist Snow Day) with rocket-boosted RC cars. Play 1v1, 2v2, 3v3, or 4v4. Blow up enemies by boosting directly into them, or don't, if you value sportsmanship over tactics. Your choice.  Eventually, you learn the finer points of flipping off of walls and flying like a witch on a broomstick - but the core game is for all intents and purposes universal. This is one of the few games I do not consider a gamble. If you are even remotely interested, put down the money for it - it is more than worth the asking price.  I recommend playing with a controller as I feel most driving games tend to feel more immersive with triggers for pedals, but do as you like. Lots of customization options make it so that you still have a sense of personality in a team game. DLC is very reasonably priced for how much I get out of the game and is released fairly regularly.  Nothing but love for this game and the devs that made it. When Snow Day playlist was yanked post-holiday season, the developers listened to the public outcry and immediately brought it back. I wish more people were like this.  Games are relatively short and very good for a quick 'pick up and play' type game. Want to kill 10 minutes? Rocket League has you covered. Want to kill 2 hours? That isn't difficult here, either. By virtue of its accessibility, it is easy to revisit this game and pick right back up without getting too rusty, and as such, I find myself constantly returning to this inbetween all the other games I'm trying. I won't be surprsied if I'm logging hours in this forever.

As someone who likes soccer and cars, this game is amazing! It's also amazing if you don't like soccer OR cars, or hate both. You can throw 15 minutes, 2 hours, or half a day into this game without ever feeling bored. Every game is different, and you're always learning new tricks and getting better.    Pros:  Length: Fun, good length games allow you to play a single match or two dozen Coop: Good for coop with friends; you can play doubles or triples, so doesn't even matter how many friends you have! Interesting: Soccer... cars... together they make for a great concept! Customization: You can customize car colours, decorations, etc., and some of them are pretty funny!   Cons:  Steep learning curve if you hop online; you start barely being able to hit the ball, although you pick it up quick. Matchmaking online: sometimes you'll get matched against a team of hardcore veterans who destroy you, and sometimes you get matched against a group of new players who you feel bad destroying. The balance is a biiiit off sometimes

479 hours in, I think I'm ready to review this. It's the most fun I've had playing games in years. I'm not a fan of racing games and the only sports game I've ever really liked was the NHL series. The combination just seems to work on a lot of fundamental levels with Rocket League.   Pros: - TIGHT controls - Challenging in a good way. Very high skill cap - 5 minute matches makes for a quick game to pick up and play for short periods of time - Local, split screen multiplayer! - Server stability  - Competitive or casual play - Multiple modes (hockey, basketball, and others) - Large community due to cross-platform play (PC, PS4, XB1) - The price. Seriously, it's a steal - DLC is cosmetic only** - Excellent selection of cosmetic items to collect, even without buying any DLC - Low system requirements - Large quarterly updates  Cons: - Some players can be ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s. Happens when any community gets large enough. There is a report feature though - Matchmaking can be poor at times, especially for new players - The challenge of learning the car and ball physics may put off some people - If you're going into the matches expecting to win 75% of the time, it's not going to happen. The matchmaking system is good enough to keep you hovering close to 50%.  Summary: I can't recommend this game enough. It's cheap and incredibly fun. I'll be playing this one for years to come.   **The cars from DLC packs have different hitboxes, which only make small differences even at the highest levels of play

Rocket League is a vehicular soccer video game developed and published by Psyonix. This game is based on you driving a vehicle. More importantly, a car. This car is your car. Fully customizable from colours to patterns. You have control over 100+ customizations from wheels, vehicles and colours with certain special items within crates to choose from to make your vehicle look astonashing kicking goals for the team. Not only that, when you win, your car is in a winner's circle for everyone to see.  You have a small amount of items when you start, but do not worry. You earn rewards after every round online, or offline. Even if you lose constantly, you still get a reward after the game, so you won't miss out on the customization goodness.  The movement is what makes this game amazing. Your vehicle has the ability to jump twice in mid-air while having a main booster rocket on the back of your vehicle. You can use this ability to advance on the ball to center, defend or attack goals. Team work is key in this game and you and your team MUST tell each other which one is defending and what vehicles are attacking. If the whole team was attacking, that will leave your goal defencless, which no one wants.  I recommend making friends in the game, making a team and working together, with stratigies and tactics in order to be the ultimate team of Rocket League!  The game runs well with lack of bugs, however i have had experience with glitches in Rumble Mode withlist having multiple items used on the ball at once, which caused it to spaz out uncontrolably.  I recommend this game highly for people wanting a challange and i do NOT recommend for people that get angry easily. I give it a 10/10

The best game you never knew you wanted. When you make your first goal and watch that ball explode everyone away from the goal as your name is plastered on the screen, you will be hooked. Even though you messed up one hundred times before then.  What makes the game great in my opinion is the level playing field. There is no ♥♥♥♥♥♥ RNG, no stupid powerups, no weapon loadouts, no pay-to-win nonsense. Every player gets a similarly handling vehicle, and there is collectible boost on the stages. That's it. The only thing seperating players is their skill level. The various techniques are nothing but an application of the resources available to all. When this comes together as it does in Rocket League, you have an easy to learn but hard to master... masterpiece.

Anyway, overall I give this game a 9/10 on it's own without the server problem and 7/10 with the server problem.  Scoring System

First Review (Many, Many Months Ago) ------------------------------------------------ I really like this game. I got it with the steam controller, and I think its so much fun. I didn't expect that. Never too late to pick this up and play. Trust me when I tell you anyone can play this game and have a blast. Kids, adults, and manchildren alike will fall in love with Rocket Leagues unique charm and style.  Easy to pick up, difficult to master - what every competitive game should be.  Pitting teams of 2 to 4 vehicles against eachother think of this as NASCAR meets futbol meets Burnout. There's not a lot to say about this game that hasn't already been said. Teams start on their side of the field and try to knock the ball into the opposing teams goal using their car. Sounds boring, but you'll soon see these are not your average cars. They are aerodynamic death machines with the ability to double jump. Yes, the cars jump - and it is fantastic.  I picked this up for $9.99 but I highly reccomend it even at it's full $19.99 price tag - this is easily a $29.99+ title.  My only gripe with the game is I prefer a mouse and keyboard and this game simply doesn't support M+KB if you want to do arial manuvers.    I do not normally enjoy driving games, but this is truly a gem.

Rocket League is a game for anyone and everyone.  It's a very simple, down to earth game that is CRAZY amounts of fun.  Here's a checklist  - Rocket powered cars - A giant soccer ball - Giant fields - Crazy fast paced gameplay - Crazy modification options for your cars - A great training system  - Cross Play with PS4 - Many other things.  To simplify  Pros - Game is absolutely amazing because you will score a goal by doing ridiculous aerial-acrobatic-rocket-powered car moves  Cons - You will lose some games because someone will score a goal by doing RIDICULOUS AERIAL-ACROBATIC-ROCKET-POWERED CAR MOVES, GOD DAMN IT HOW WAS I SUPPOSED TO SAVE THAT CMON?!?!?!?!

From what I've played this game is fantastic. There's a variety of different modes and it's a fun casual game to play when bored. However, one aspect is infuriating, if not game-breaking. When a player leaves in the middle of a game, there is an AI that plays in their stead. This would be fine if the AI acted like a normal player. The problem is, players are very inaccurate and programmed inaccuracy can never be equal to the inaccuracies of human error. As a result, the AI is either overpowered or terrible. I was playing a game and we scored in the first thirty seconds or so. A player on the enemy team left. The AI who replaced it proceeded to score five goals by the end of the game with it's teamates scoring zero goals and it blocking essentially every shot we took. I would most certainly recommend this game and I would most certainly recommend that, if an AI is on the other team, you should leave immediately.

I first downloaded Rocket League on the PS4 because it was free for PS+ members. Since playing on the PS4 and enjoying it so much I felt so bad that I got the game for free that I had to come over and pay full price on Steam for it. The controls are simple enough that you'll feel like a badass playmaker your first game or so. Oh and the addition of local co-op and cross platform play is really nice to see too.

EDIT: They added time limit bans for people quitting early from Matchmaking!! Changing my No to a yes. It's perfect.  DONT READ, ITS ALL MOOT NOW  13 hours in  about 4 hours were casual play  Then i started ranked. Oh my god. There is NO punishment for leaving a ranked game. Enter a 3 v 3 RANKED match... let's say the opposing team scores within 30 seconds. I can GUARANTEE one of your teammates will leave before the replay of the goal is even finished. No one will come in to fill their spot. Your team will most likely lose at this point.  'OK', I originally thought, 'He's getting his comeuppance. He'll be deranked quickly if he keeps that ♥♥♥♥ up.' Yet i've played match after match, again and again, regardless of if its my team scoring first or theirs. Someone will always quit. 'can't be worse than this' I reason.  oh but it can. It really can.  Wait until TWO opponents/teammates leave. 1 vs 3.. within the first 60 seconds of a RANKED game that lasts for 5 minutes. It's not fun for either side.  So, I thought 'OK, 2 v 2 must be pretty intense then. At least in 3 v 3 you have a (slight) chance of still winning if one of your teammates ♥♥♥♥♥es out. They must have more respect in a 2 v 2 then, right?' Nope.  2 v 2 is even worse.  I've had to play MANY 1 v 2 games. It's horrible. Why even create the 'RANKED' gameplay if there is no punishment for quitting a match early? There's no loss in your overall 'rank'! The worst part... I've started quitting ranked matches myself because I let an easy save into the goal, or maybe I missed an easy goal. Why do I care if I quit? Why SHOULD I care? I don't. I can save myself time by quitting right now without any consequences.  It's cancer. It really is. The game should implement something like CS:GO where you are banned for X amount of time each match you quit. I've always, ALWAYS, hated people who did this type of ♥♥♥♥ in any game.. yet here I am, slowly realizing that 'My team WILL lose, so why waste my time attempting to win? I got better things to do.' so I'll quit the match.  It's not a good culture to breed your game into.

As someone who likes soccer and cars, this game is amazing! It's also amazing if you don't like soccer OR cars, or hate both. You can throw 15 minutes, 2 hours, or half a day into this game without ever feeling bored. Every game is different, and you're always learning new tricks and getting better.    Pros:  Length: Fun, good length games allow you to play a single match or two dozen Coop: Good for coop with friends; you can play doubles or triples, so doesn't even matter how many friends you have! Interesting: Soccer... cars... together they make for a great concept! Customization: You can customize car colours, decorations, etc., and some of them are pretty funny!   Cons:  Steep learning curve if you hop online; you start barely being able to hit the ball, although you pick it up quick. Matchmaking online: sometimes you'll get matched against a team of hardcore veterans who destroy you, and sometimes you get matched against a group of new players who you feel bad destroying. The balance is a biiiit off sometimes

I like it. It's very good. The hum of the engines on the turf encapsulates the exciting football-orientated theme of this sport game. There is a reason that this game has been on the top-seller list for a month: it is addicting. Every game is match-based: your existence while playing this game is to score as many goals in 5 minutes against the other team while simultaneously protecting your goal. There is a massive amount of skill involved but that should not deter new players as the mechanics are quite simple and easy to learn. I see this as a big e-sports game in the future. Get ready to scream from excitement and then let the tears flow as you make amazing goals and accidently score on your own team.

Beyond the spot-on controls, the balanced skill-based gameplay, or the throw-your-fists-in-the-air-and-shout-GOOOOAAAAALLLLLLL compulsion invoked by finally getting that damn ball in the goal, Rocket League is a very well thought out game and great design choices are found at every corner.  One thing I've enjoyed in particular about this title is it's superb sound design. You'll hear the audience in the giant rocket-soccer stadiums cheer when you make goals, gasp at great saves, and yell in shock when you destroy another player. Barely perceptible vu vu zella's mixed in with crowd noise, that awesome train horn when you score a goal, that relieving tone when you pull off epic goal defense, every aspect of this game's sound design really adds a layer of polish that makes this game shine (assuming you can hear something shine, that is).  The above, and many more things, have made Rocket League my favorite title of 2015 so far.

Easy to learn. Hard to master.  Rocket League is such a blast for what it offers everyone = fast, intense, futball/soccer with cars. The testosterone levels in this product is absolutely crazy. For a game that focuses on that, you gotta be able to retain the attention of the audience who plays it, and boy does it capture it. Multiplayer is a blast, when the servers are up however, but the developers are working on fixing it and are very communicative on social media.  Cross platform play for PC and PS4 is even better, however it is only limited by the fact that you have to go through matchmaking and get lucky if you get paired up with a buddy of yours on PS4. HOWEVER, the devs have stated that they are working on a solution to at least allow PC peeps to invite PS4 peeps into private matches, and hopefully down the line, maybe have parties that go into match making. Should this go through, this game will be even more praiseworthy in the sense that it allows for such cross-platform play.   My concern for this is the content. Most the maps are the same, but with free map DLC's coming out, it should be fixed. Maybe different map layouts might be a thing, for that will allow different strategies and tactics. Car customization is nice, but it is only cosmetic, and I feel like that is the case so it is an even playing field for everyone. Special abilities could make it into the game, but that runs the risk of balancing and complexifying a game that is supposed to be focused on one thing - fun.   Who knows how this will play out in the future, but for now, Rocket League is an outstanding product. Split screen multiplayer, especially on PC, is a rarity and for Rocket League to include it will only introduce hours of rage filled fun with all my buds and family. For $20, it's worth every penny to me. It is a fun game, i enjoy every bit of it. It keeps me on my toes(or the edge of the seat, realistically) and just makes me look forward to the next round. Buy it and spread the word. If you have friends on PS4, tell them to get it, since most of those guys have Playstation Plus, and it is free for July.  Word of Advice to all you guys out there who have the game or who bought it - Communicate. Figure out the keybindings for voice chatting or the quick text chat. Communicate with your team. Laugh, Scream, do whatever(well almost everything). It will make the game even more frantic and fun. I hope I'll see yall out there. If you guys see me in your games, just give me a shout out and talk! I love a good convo or communication with my teammates! Make friends on this game! Most of all, have fun.

Rocket League... what can I say that hasn't been said?  Well, maybe not much, but if this review happens to help someone out there, I'll be happy! :)  First off, even though the game is quite competitive, you can still play casual matches that are are nearly identical to their ranked/competitive counterparts, which I find to be very catering to a casual player as opposed to a game like CS:GO which has a casual mode that differs quite a bit from actual 'competitive' matches. So if start off playing Rocket League casually, and later want to play ranked games, it is very easy to do so.  The second point is that there is so much depth and potential to the movement mechanics in the game, many of which you have probably seen on YouTube on some crazy, 'Goal Compilation'. This creates a very high skill ceiling for the competive player. Rocket League is a game that is easy to pick up, but takes lots of time to master.  There are many other points about the game such it's custimization, local multiplayer, mutators, different arenas and more that I won't mention here because many other people have gone more in depth in them.  However if you play the game either casually or competitively, I HIGHLY recommend that you purchase a Xbox or PS4 controller for the game, it makes the controls feel a lot better then using a mouse and keyboard, and I believe it can help you play a little better as well. However this will cost you a bit extra, but I would encourage you to envest in it. If you are on a budget and can't afford a controller, a mouse and keyboard will suit you just fine.  In conclusion, if you enjoy a fun, almost arcade feeling, short round based (competitive) game, then I believe that you should give Rocket League a try!

This game is pure fun when played with friends and even chaotic at 4vs4. Your objective is to get the ball to the enemy's goal under 5 min using car, just like a soccer game but with car. Sound simple, but hard to master. As the play require skill and in depth understanding of how game mechanic work. You have to use advanced technique such as aeriel manuever, boost management, juggling and many amazing play that you can muster.  You can choose from 1vs 1, 2vs 2 ,3vs3, or 4vs4. Ranked match, private lobby, pub , and local play is possible. And the best thing, local play support splitscreen! Want to have fun in one monitor? No problem! Up to 4 player possible and 8 player can join through LAN. Customization lie solely on cosmetic and each car have no different in ability, so they are balanced by the fact each player have to play with similar limit. The difference s only the hitbox of different car. So, player skill play a major role here.  With a lot of achievement, trophy, EXP based level up, stat,and leaderboard, this game bring high replayability value and 'bragging right' among player and friends. You can exchange stat and be proud of your 'MAD SKILLZ'. just 3 days after release the competitive scene have an eye on the game.   Esport  [play.eslgaming.com]  now plan to establish rocket league cups on August. IMO this is deserved because there is high competitive value with depth gameplay lie on the game. Example for pro play can be seen here:  Link   [www.twitch.tv]  This game also released on PS4 and available for free for PS+ user this month. So get em! Currently cross-platform support is being developed on the way. So expect more player to come when it is finished. The only problem this game has is server issue due to server overload. More than 10, 000 player concurrently with limited server capacity due to dev budget make the server down a commonplace. Expect it to fixed later this year. All in all. This game is fun in purest form that you can't expect with any game nowsaday. Buy this game with friends now!

RC Rocket Powered Soccer/Football at its finest, this game is loved by all age groups :D  Some people complain that it's a little difficult to get the hang of, but i assure you, just some time practicing and you'll be surprising yourself, laughing, scoring, blowing cars up, flying accross the Dome-Stadium and bicycle kicking your way to the TOP!  suggest this to every one and everyone!  there is currently only ONE flaw with this game. The party system. You can have a party, but you can only play ranked with 1 other person for 2v2's. The only other ranked gametypes are for solo play, and they are 1v1-2v2-3v3 I believe they should allow parties to play anything from 2v2-4v4 RANKED. The game is a ton of fun. I gve it a 8/10 for competitive match type games.   There are two things I would change though. This is just my personal opinion but I think it would make the game much better for all.  First I would take out the ability to 'fly'. I get it, it's pretty, and it does take some skill to do, but the problem is there are a lot of players who prefer keyboard and mouse, like myself. Using this ability is much harder on keyboard and mouse than it is on controller, giving those using controller and proficient with it an advantage. Just a thought, I think it's not really needed in a futbol game.  Then I would make demolition 'kills' last longer. Not too long, but right now there is no real benefit to demolishing an opponent, they spawn rather quickly and of no consequence. Either don't allow it or make it have some kind of consequence, make players have to keep their eye open for possible incoming in hopes of avoiding it. The only time it really benefits you is when you hit the goalie and the ball is already right on their goal.  Otherwise a super fun game. So far I've only played a few hours of it. Mostly playing Ranked right now, reached Silver so far in standard 3v3. I definitely reccomend it even with the things I would change.

It will never stop being challenging and will never become too difficult to insure someone ragequits.

Rocket League, the relaunched version of the well known SARPBC game is the follow-up and improved (imo) version of it's older brother. The game is simple, you have multiple amounts (1v1, 2v2, 3v3, 4v4) of players that battle eachother with rocketpowered toy cars and try to get the ball in the opponent's goal. Sounds pretty simple, and that's Rocket League's strength.. AT FIRST.  You start out with equal ranked players, unless you have more experienced players in your party, and you start the basics. Jumping, Double Jumping, Defending, Trying to ACTUALLY hit that ball without looking like a 'noob', etc.  The more matches you play, the more experienced players you encounter (granted, there's high-level players who are ♥♥♥♥ at the game too), the more awesome goals you'll see happening.  Hovering, Learning how to play with your team.. That's the harder part.   You can design your own cars with the unlockable stickers/decals/styles/hats/trails/.. and that's fine. You can choose how you look in this game, but there's some actual restrictions (you'll find out).   Do I recommend this game? Yes! Is it unplayable without controller? For me, it is.. Do you need to buy DLC for it? Not really, it's all about your personal choice. Stadiums are free. Is it better on PC or PS4? For me, it's the same, since I play with a PS4-controller, but typing goes faster on PC.. That's it.   Hope you have fun with it, the game is worth the money either way!
