So, I Pre-Ordered the Steam Controller. I wanted it for Darksouls 3. I saw that I got Rocket League and Portal 2 for having done so. I didn't expect to enjoy this game. I had no intention of ever even looking at the game. I was bored one day and figured I'd try it....  Man... Oh man... What did I do to myself?  This game is fantastic. I wouldn't have been able to tell you that by looking at it or watching other people play it, it's just an experience. The game is surprisingly fun, and it is super super SUUUUPER hard! I'm usually good with this sort of game(Games that require manipulation of projectiles). This game just sort of throws you for a loop though, learning where to hit the ball and how to hit the ball and how to choose when to double jump or jump and flip... There's a lot to this simple game. Working the camera is as much a skill as actually hitting the ball and making it go where you want it to go. The players that are actually good at the game stand far apart from the players that aren't. You can pick them out of the crowd like sore thumbs. The way they manipulate the ball is like an elaborate dance compared to the way newer players thrash and flail against the balls like uncoordinated children.   This is the sort of game that you can expect to, when putting in the effort, grow exponetially and actually make a difference for your 3 man team. Go reap some glory! Feel the exhiliration as you knock that ball perfectly into that net (or inversely feel the shame you experience upon missing that clutch goal block).

This review is a comparison from the previous game.  i've played super rocket powered acrobatic battle cars (long name) and loved it.  This game however improved a lot in diferent aspects:  - one of the most funniest games in steam  - AL bots are better: they now can enter in online games, no more handicap games (they can score amazing goals against noobs).  - Customize: i like the ideia to create your own car  - You dont need controller to play this, keyboard is fine, i do hat tricks all the time believe me  (but if u want to do some serious gaming i recommend it)  - Dont waste time, u can do stuff while waiting for a match.   Unfortunately theres cons, they removed some great stuff from SRPABC, but can be patched:  - No Auto-goals (theres lots of people who deserve humilation award )   - Reward medals at the end of each game. The only award avaible is the MVP award  they removed best wingman, goal keeper , and more... (its always good to have a shelf full of awards) medals can improve moral and performance. its scietific fact   - All the maps have the same format, the previous game had funny maps. i would like to see this in a patch some day but i dont know if its possible. the old maps are great.   i think its all i dont remember any more details, have fun.

Chicken Pot Pie  What you'll need.  1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cubed Chicken Breasts Boneless Skinless 1 lb For $1.99 - Expires in 6 days 1 cup sliced carrots 1 cup frozen green peas 1/2 cup sliced celery 1/3 cup butter Great Value Sweet Cream Salted Butter Sticks, 4 count, 16 oz 1/3 cup chopped onion 1/3 cup all-purpose flour 1/2 teaspoon salt 1/4 teaspoon black pepper 1/4 teaspoon celery seed 1 3/4 cups chicken broth 2/3 cup milk 2 (9 inch) unbaked pie crusts  Cooking Instructions   1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C.)  2. In a saucepan, combine chicken, carrots, peas, and celery. Add water to cover and boil for 15 minutes. Remove from heat, drain and set aside.  3. In the saucepan over medium heat, cook onions in butter until soft and translucent. Stir in flour, salt, pepper, and celery seed. Slowly stir in chicken broth and milk. Simmer over medium-low heat until thick. Remove from heat and set aside.  4. Place the chicken mixture in bottom pie crust. Pour hot liquid mixture over. Cover with top crust, seal edges, and cut away excess dough. Make several small slits in the top to allow steam to escape.  5. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes, or until pastry is golden brown and filling is bubbly. Cool for 10 minutes before serving.

My boy Bobby has been playing this League of Rockets nonsense for quite a long time, and it concerned me and my wife Peggy quite a bit. What boy plays virtual soccer with virtual cars? That boy ain't right! I knew that the only way to defeat the mind-corrupting menace was to destroy it with my propane purification powers. After loading up my pickup with as much propane as I could, I found the League headquarters, and proceeded to sell them as much propane as they would take. After several minutes, one of the developers offered me a copy of the game. At first, I denied profusely, fearing being corrupted myself. But then I realized that I could destroy the Rocket League from within. I took the copy home, and discovered the true beauty of smacking a virtual ball using my propane-boosted Paladin!

This is game is more fun than hanging out with Bill Murray all night. In fact the only thing that could be more fun than this game, is playing this game with BIll Murray on the couch next to you. Rocket League strikes the perfect balance between competitive and casual. The game presents a simple platform with some relatively uncomplicated controls and the simplest of objectives (push the ball into the goal), but providing the player enough control over their vehicle that there is a huge skill-cap. It is a game that takes practice to get good, but it is not a game where you have to be good to have fun. Even on my first game, not even coming close to scoring a goal, I was hooked. This game completely took the gaming world by storm and for good reason - it's fast, fun, and addicting. Do yourself a favor and grab it - it's worth every penny!

Rocket League is well worth your money. It's a refreshing entry in the virtual sports genre and one that doesn't take itself too seriously. The basics of the game (double jumps, boosts) are easy to get the hang of. Don't want to embarass yourself online? Start a single-player campaign or just revisit the tutorial to hone your skills. Plus, you can just jump online, play a five-minute match and get out. Great for when you have an hour or two to kill.   The servers were a bit laggy after launch, but this has been largely resolved. When it comes to multinational servers, there are always improvements to be made, but Rocket League has tidied itself up quite nicely. The online ranking system could have been deeper, but it gets the job done. After a while, it becomes addicting to see your ranking points increase or decrease after every match, urging you to play another quick game to compensate for that one loss or keep the winning streak going.  In short, Rocket League is a nice little game, with a simple and fun formula, but also a game that gives you all the tools to develop your own playing style. Not one match you play will ever be the same. Grab a couple friends and start playing right now.

Awesome game! I HIGHLY recommend this to anyone getting into PC gaming. If you're into arcade-sports games (NFL Blitz, NHL Hitz, Mario Tennis, Mario Strikers, etc.) then you will LOVE Rocket League! This is a game where skill defines outcome.   Skill is the most important thing, but the game is setup to allow for luck to be an influential part of the game. I've spent many hours playing Rocket League with friends and I see myself playing many more. The game is short enough that it's not a tremendous time commitment, yet it has enough depth to feel satisfying. There's plenty of skill technical skill, strategy, and communication in order of importance.   This is truly a game that you can start playing and have tons of fun without spending hours researching meta and watching streamers' tutorials.The built-in tutorials are useful, the graphics are pretty, and the cross-platform options are nice. I play with a controller and find it relaxing to step away from KBAM and get into the game. Everytime I play Rocket League, my wife laughs at how excited and into the game I get and she enjoys watching and hearing the commentary. Definitely worth the buy!

After 100 hours of playing this absolutely wonderful game, I would recommend this to anyone who wants to play football with customizeable RC cars and different courts and different balls and WHAPOW!!! and KABOOM!!!. The one and only problem has been playing with PS4-players. Not because that they would be annoying (they aren't, really), but because it's not possible to create a party where both PC- and PS4-players could join. So, dear creators of Rocket League, could you possibly add something like a 'Join Party' -option in the next update, and with that option the players from different devices could join eachother's parties with a party number or something like that, so it would be possible to play in online matches together. Besides that, I would rate this game 5/5 because of the insane action, great graphics and gameplay, and because of having fun with friends in a way that can't be reached in real life social occasions.  Please, buy this game. It's worth trying (and getting addicted to) ;)  (sry 4 bad Engles)

Super fun game if you view it as a party game, or something just to kill time. Don't get sucked in too hard on rankings and you have a ton of fun with it. Also, highly recommend coming up with your own terminology for moves you pull off in the game, as it makes commentary with friends extremely fun.   Try using 'boop' when you set someone up, 'cheeky horn corp' when you try a sick aerial, 'cheeky king lou' when you get a nice bicycle kick, a 'folly floater' for a long, slow shot across the field, a 'lazy susan' for a slow goal, 'spicy susan' for a fast goal, and a 'tositios© mild slasa susan' for a medium speed goal. Also, when you over-commit for a goal and the opponents end up scoring because no one is back playing goal, make sure to call it a 'Shaboobadoopy.' Trust me, it's a ton of fun.

Wow, this game exceeded my expectations. I was expecting a car game where you drive around and hit balls into goals. I got that, but I also thought that it would be really boring and would be a game trend that fades away quickly. That's one reason I was hesitating to buy this. I waited until it was $13.99 on sale and I bought it. The graphics are AMAZING for an indie game, the gameplay (even the singleplayer which I play a lot) is very smooth and fun to play. So far the community that I've met is very friendly and are never poor sports. I really like all the customization options you have and that you can have antennas that are video game and company based (VAULT BOY WOOT). As a child I used to play a lot of racing games like Project Gotham Racing for the 1st Xbox and I can just tell that if I were a kid (not a squid), I would love this game even more than I do now. (NOTE: I recommend playing with a controller because it's much easier to play with. I use the Xbox One controller when I play. Oh and the keys are all able to be remapped.) This is the first review where I've actually written over 6 sentences. I rate this game 10/10.  July 4th Edit: Okay I'm coming back late July 4th to revise my review. I now have 54 hours and I have become addicted to this game again. I've learned the ways of double jumping and predicting people's actions and I'm now practicing aerials. I'm level 27 and I can say that this game is still very fun when you get competitive at it. Now, I am not the best level 27, but it's still fun to play. Also, playing this game with friends is very fun (WHEN THEY PLAY WITH YOU), and it can be very funny at times, and very, very salty. You may say things you don't mean, too... (like I'M NEVER PLAYING COMPETITIVE WITH YOU AGAIN, YOU SCORED TWICE ON OUR OWN GOAL!) It's all fun.  I do really recommend this game, but remember: it's easy to start playing but very, VERY hard to master.

What can I say about Rocket League?   Well, this game is fenomenal. It is the perfect example of a game that is fun and easy to pick up and play but incredibly hard to master. Just the idea of cars driving around, boosting, flying to score a goal is a fantastic concept. I have put 350 hours into this game and I still am not near the top ranks. I am around the middle.  Pros: Easy to pick up. Hard to master. Flying cars. Many, many cars to chose from. You can customise these cars with antennas, toppers, paint jobs and even decals. It is a fantastic eSport to watch. Montages look amazing. Many DLC's to come. Did I mention flying cars?   Cons: If you do not have a controller, this game can be a nightmare to learn. You can get extremely ♥♥♥♥♥♥ off if you solo in ranked. The community can be highly toxic so just let it sink in. They are adding micro-transactions in the future though I do not know what for. All DLC is not free, but pretty cheap.  Overall, my Cons are just some personal things I do not like but don't let it put you off this game.  IF YOU LIKE CARS, FOOTBALL OR EVEN JUST THE CONCEPT OF FLYING CARS, THIS GAME IS FOR YOU!

You have a rocket/boost button which allows you to rocket yourself into the air and score all kinds of trick shots.   One of the most fun games to play against friends, or with them online against others.

This game.. This game.. Probably the most fun, and most hair pulling aggrevation I've had in my life. Nobody has ever claimed it to be perfect and its not. However, aside from the games mistakes and glitches in regards to hitting, blocking, scoring etc that only happens every now and then this is a great game full of head scratching failures.  Cons: 1.) They seem to not want to open up more Ranked areas. We need ranked areas for special maps, hockey and basketball. This would be Zero cost to the developer and a world of gain but the completely ignore us. 2.) Wasteland is the crappiest map ever made. Why force us to play it in Ranked? Make a new Ranked that lets people play the way they want to play. 3.) Lag, your servers need reset or something more often. 4.) Map rotation, How hard is it to add a check to see if I've been stuck playing wasteland 4-5 times in a row? Pretty hard I guess. 5.) Listen to your audience, quit forcing things down our throats. There are 18,000 players. There is no reason to force all players to play all maps. Give us a clean competitive Ranked mode and a custom fun ranked mode. I'd play both! I really would! but GEEZZ let US choose.  Pros: It never gets old, infinite fun and I pretty much play every day.

If you are looking for something to remind you why you love and play games in the first place, this is it.

This is my first review. It just so happens that my first review was on my favorite game. Rocket League. Rocket League is my favorite game, as stated before, and due to this it is hard to criticize. However, they somehow give me things to nag about. Such as, Neo Tokyo inside of competitive play. Nobody likes Neo Tokyo in the first place, I believe that it is the worst map in the game. Well, aside from Aquadome (For some people).   For most people (excluding me) Aquadome causes some issues for some players. Mainly the frame rate. This is a big issue for most players, and only some can play on maximum settings. Obviously every person isn't going to have a $2,000 gaming PC, BUT, I believe they could better optimize the game. Or, dumb down the maps that make people's games lag. (Aquadome, Wasteland, etc.)  Aside from the frame rate issues, nothing much else to critique. People seem to think micro-transactions are a point against the game. The Micro-Transactions keep the game running. (servers, etc.). Also, the keys are quite cheap (compared to most games like CS:GO.)

Played 13 hours straight on my first day...  Edit: A year later they have now added RANDOMIZED microtransactions...in a B2P game...that already had microtransactions...  Matchmaking is still almost as bad as it was at launch, and the ranking system is still awful.

There is literally no other game in existence like Rocket League. It's car soccer! Easy to pick up, super difficult to master, tight controls, multiple game modes, quick games, solid net play, fast paced and fun gameplay. I play a lot of games and I play a lot online competitive games and nothing gets me hootin' and hollerin' like Rocket League. Even when I'm losing I'm having a good time!

It's kind of funny to look at myself several weeks back when I was completely ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ over this game despite seeing a huge community and hype surrounding it. This is one of the first times that I'm totally happy I was wrong all the way along.  The game mechanics are smooth, controls are responsive, very easy to get used to, offers great variety of visual options with stunning graphics, as well as will run perfectly even on your potato rig.   The beauty of Rocket League is that it successfully attracts casual gamers, as well as hardcore players because the 'easy to learn, but hard to master' technique is the perfect definition of this game and it has become one of my favourite games to spend my time with friends.  9/10

Last update added lab maps to standard rotation. I was pi**ed, but I have seen some plays done in the added maps that are simply amazing. I guess I am still pi**ed, but I also won't just say Psyonix is ruining RL just because of this. I know a lot of people hated Wasteland when it was added, which I didn't mind - then they added the underwater one and my underpowered PC's fps dipped quite a bit. Around the same time my fps nearly crashed when using my mic and even sometimes when another player uses their's which it had never done before. The game is still amazing and the most-played game in my Steam library, I just hope they add more customization to how players can control what maps are in the rotation - maybe add a voting system if the upcoming pitch has however many dislikes so players can vote to skip (always skipping to one without any dislikes or the fewest dislikes if all have someone disliking)

I have many hours in this game. Not as many as others, but still more than some. The first thing that I want to say about this game is that there is always fun to be had in here. I do get ♥♥♥♥♥♥ with bs hits and such, but that is with any game. The contact between cars is a little exagerated and really annoying but if this game had the same physical as The Next Car Game: Wreckfest, then these games wouldn't last as much as some of these games go. (5 min regulation and 5 min OT) Now that I think about it, that would be an entertaining version to this game: Demolition Derby Soccer? I would buy that. Now for the Devs, could we maybe get a GhostBusters vehicle? That would be nice.  Now, for the maps, there are a few that are recylced throught the game with minimal differences between the number of players on the field. There are 3 other game modes that I don't play often but get have a lot of fun with. They are: SnowDay (with a hockey puck instead of a soccerball), Hoops (basketball, involves a lot of well timed jumps and damn good aim), and Rocket Lab (this is where you play real working copies of maps and modes that the Devs include with updates. There are some good and not-so-good maps.).

Great game with even greater mechanics. Twist and turn your way to be the best player and or the best team. This surprisingly detailed game is more fun than it looks. So grab some friends and boost you way to the top!

Even if you don't care about sports or racing, this game is so fast-paced and zany that you can't help but want to play one more match. It can be difficult to pick up at first, and I really do recommend you do the practice sessions first so you can acquaint yourself with how to move your vehicle around the best way. You'll probably fumble a lot trying to hit the ball at all let alone accurately.   The great thing about this game though, is that it's always fun, even if you suck. Playing the game with friends is highly recommended too as it absolutely doubles the fun, and I really like how matchmaking takes parties into account to assure you'll be on the same team as your friends in online play.  The one thing that I'll complain about is that the AI can still do really dumb things, even if you're playing at higher skill levels I have seen some bots just casually drive the ball into their own goal for no reason. It can be quite frustrating to play offline if you're essentially carrying your team.  I should also mention, that if you're ever starting to get bored of the standard arenas, I highly recommend you try some of the rocket lab arenas to completely change things up. It seems right now that not many people play on them but I promise you they are worth it and demand a whole new strategy and style of play.

+ really awesome gameplay, addictive game, gameplay-wise 10/10. For the record, I never played any game more than a month or two, every time I just got bored eventually and had to lay the game off. I am editing my review as I feel it should be a bit more serious to the person wondering about this game.  This game mixes cars with rockets and a number of different sports. There is hockey, soccer(or football) and basketball at the moment and there is also some different stuff such as a test lab which is a odd mode to say the least along with different amounts of players for certain modes and even competitive leagues. The game also offers many servers throughout the world allowing for most people to stay under 100 ping for more fluid gameplay or making it easy to play with friends without having to worry as much if they are a bit far away. This game has an amazing soundtrack and truely looks and feels great. The game may be fun for people who like sports but want to see a twist on it. This game also is friendly to beginners and offers a gradual learning curve. I personally don't play this game often due to it getting a little bit boring if you play it over an hour or two at a time. I would still recommend this game due to the low pricetag, fun gameplay and the amount of stuff to do. Overall I myself give this game an 8 out of 10.

What can I say. WHAT CAN I SAY! This game, IS FRIGGIN RIDONKABONACUCOLOUS. I haven't had such fun in a long, LONG time. BUTT WEIGHT, if you REALLY want to have bonkers fun, get a couple of your friends into the game and trust me, you will have a great time. Nonetheless, great game. 13/9 would play.  P.S. - Hazards may include broken controller and rage quits.  EDIT1: OMFG ;-; still in love with this game

Rocket League is a multiplayer sports/driving game where you play 3v3 to try and score goals over 5 minutes of play. There are also options of 2v2, 4v4 and other unconventional modes such as Hoops and asymmetric futbol maps.  This game has a very high skill ceiling but is easily accessible to the pleb gamer like myself, and a lot of nuance behind what is essentially a very simple premise: score goals. When you screw up, it's pretty obvious that it's your own fault and the game isn't unfair on that front.   The music in menus are a very small part of the experience, but is quite chill nonetheless.  Psyonix also knows how to do good DLC. The entirety of it is purely aesthetic in nature, and there are plenty of free updates so none of the playing content is locked behind a paywall. The packages are small, morsel-like bites of additional customisation for your car, and as at 15/05/2016, I own 1 DLC currently.  Speaking of customisation, there are extensive options for paint jobs, decals, wheels, antennae, toppers, boosts which helps keep the aesthetics of the game fresh.  I am absolute dogshit at the game, but it is fun in its own merit and would definitely recommend this game, though it must be noted that the majority of my playtime has been with mates over Skype, so YMMV.

A very fun soccer type game where teamwork is absolutely necessary. Playing this game with friends is a blast, with every moment of a match making my team/friends twitch. It really keeps you on edge without being stressful.

Lauded for its intuitive controls, balanced play, and pick-up-and-play multiplayer in every which way (be it online, or split-screen lan), the simple concept of car soccer has never been so appealing. The developers are big now, but a happy community has always been their #1 priority. A controller is recommended to prevent carpal tunnel.   This is a phenomenal game to play at all ages and appeals to every genre. I've detested racing games or anything related to a sport, but after enough peer pressure and I've already sunk a respectable amount of hours into it. It works as a pick-up-and-play because of its short time spans in each game - 5 minutes. You can play up to 4 cars a side, and it now has hockey and basketball types. Worthwhile content is free, but you pay extra for cosmetic cars and decals. Matchmaking is fast, and the competitive rank-up system is a nice touch to keep you interested in playing from time to time.    A note for people starting out:

I've had my eyes on this game ever since it came out, drooling at gameplay videos from YouTube, articles from IGN and reviews from both websites *cough*AngryJoe*cough*, but could never have the guts to persuade my parents to let me borrow their money to pay for it, because I'm lazy and don't have a job...  Fast forward to around a few days ago at the time of this review, when Rocket League became free-to-play to all for a limited time because of the NBA, I believe... Anyway, of course, I quickly downloaded the game, and what a shocker, I was terrible first time around when playing against bots. I was using a mouse and keyboard the first time around (noob, I know, as many from where I went have said that controller is the master race), then quickly realised my grave mistake and switched them up with an old Xbox 360 controller I had lying around.  I quickly learned the basics of the controls thanks to the tutorial, as well as getting used to the new control setup with the controller, and jumped straight into a few online matches. To my surprise, I did pretty well the first couple of times. Sure, there were ♥♥♥♥-ups here and there, but I don't think it was along the lines of, 'OMG! Wow! Stop playing this now!' Also, fyi, I LOVE the little text thingies you can spam to everybody, those are fun as hell.  After playing for the few days that it was avaliable, I spent around 16 hours on it, which I believe is the longest I've spend on a game in one go without playing another in between, which is a huge achievement on my part. During that time, I was absolutely begging myself to take the £8.99 deal it had during this current time, and here I am writing this review just minutes after using my parents' money to buy this game.  All I have to say is that you will LOVE this game, even if you don't like sports games, because it's extremely fun, and I definitely plan on playing this for much longer than just 16 hours...  10/10

I've only managed to find a few small flaws with the game; one of them is that some cars are just not as good as others if you factor hitbox, (boosted) turnrate and handbrake-turn-speed into your considerations- there are clear best cars, and always will be, but some of the ones that are lacking could probably be fairly easily brought up to par (with minor buffs to the aforementioned attributes). I'm sure they'll sort it out as they see fit. All of them are viable, some just a lot more so than others.  As a second flaw, there seem to be some weird issues surrounding USB devices with no clear solution. Even original xbox controllers disconnecting and then reconnecting randomly, the left stick suddenly not working in menus, stuff like that which seems to be related to other USB devices connected to the system, but a game-flaw nevertheless.  The soundtrack is pretty garbo imo, interchangeable radio tunes. Lots of people like it and that's the point, so who am I to disagree? I just turned it off.  Addictive as ♥♥♥♥, virtually limitless skill-ceiling from what I have seen, my only regret is that I waited this long to get the game. My thumbs hurt.

The game directors that look at Top Gear, and went, 'Hey, that looks fun.'  And it was. It was great fun. In fact, I think that Rocket League is one f the most fun games on my Steam list. The mechanics are done well, the car is sharp and responsive (unless you hold down the handbrake button) and you really feel that when you hitt a ball with a car, you have hit a ball with a car. You can change the settings of the match, things like gravity, (Yes, I know. shappe of the ball, and you can even put the game into slo-motion. (I don't quite now why, though...) It is multiplayer, and you can even play a match with someone that isn't your Steam friend! It can be a singleplayer thing because you can play exhibit matches, and season matches.  It is the best game. 10/10  UPDATE_  They updated the game and it now has microtransactions...  ):  7/10 For microtransactions

This game is fun and adictive. simple at heart but complex when it all falls in to place, the main aim of the game is to score as many goals as you can in 5 mins and the team with the most amount of goals wins, if the game is tying at the end of the 5 mins it goes to a very tense tie-breaker. The tie-breakers can go on for any amount of time and you only need one goal to score them. this is the game, yes there are more modes that you can try like basketball, hockey and many more. You can customise your car by putting hats and boosts to give it your own twist. All of the cars have unique hit-boxes and turning radi (so you can find the one that is the best for you, and new updates every month you willbe hooked for ages. However now they have added Micro-D.L.C like C.S.G.O's case system sadly this pulls the game down but not to much to make it a bad game.  this game i a must own that can pull 100 of hours out of in days 9/10,only small issues!

The microtransactions between the cars to you can buy is both good and bad cause in the start they would add more than one car to each pack now they just stick with one and to get 2 cars as you did before now cost 5,97€ where before it would cost 3,99€ + new maps included. I loaded up my Rocket League and went to my garage to see what was new. I try to switch my loadout and a window pops up, stopping the game, say that Rocket League has stopped working and then closes the game. So, I try getting back on, go into my garage, and it works! I click to change tires, and the same thing happens. I reload the game for a third time and the garage works perfectly fine. I try finding a match and as soon as I join, the game stops again! The fouth time, I didn't even get to find a match before it stopped the game again. I don't understand, I purchased this game sometime in September. Ever time I tried it before, it worked fine. No bugs or anything. Now I don't play it for a month and it doesn't work anymore. I'm very disappointed expecially since I also purchased this game for my friend right around the same time I did so for myself. My friend's game still works but mine doesn't. I want this fixed or I want a refund. I am tired of my games that I purchase end up not working after I don't play them for a little bit. I still update them! I want my money back or I want it fixed, or I want a sollution to fixing this problem. Please help me fix this.

Keeping it simple seems a lot has been said about this game, it is just wonderful, you can not like it or not get into it, but you can't deny the fact that it's a really good game.  Let's start from the beggining, simple idea: cars and balls. Ok it's fun, but let's add some more: jumps and turbo. BOOM! Now it's crazy, fast, vertical, horizontal, diagonal and madness all around. Moreover, adding with thate a nice set of precise controls, most of the time, and some very neat visuals and graphics you have one of the most wonderful sports-game like experiencies.   What mesmerized me about this game is the feeling of control you have over the car, once you learn the basics and start trying to do the fancy things (flying, walls, ball control, plays, backwards, etc) you start to really appreciate how many oportunities you have to move around and play the different modes.  Regarding the modes, once you got this wonderful system, you complete it with different play styles, different cars, locations and customizations and you just make it more easy for people to enjoy it. Take for instance the hoops update, you leanred how to play and fly in the big pitch of the usual modes and you now have to control every bounce and rebound from every corner to defend or attack the hoop, the rules change and your game has to adapt to them. Another example is the rocket labs modes, just by adding different levels or different goals you game has to change and adapt, and you discover new ways to control your car to do so.  Finally, another nice point is that it's a game you buy, for a pretty reasonable price, and you get all the contents and updates for free, having only to pay for some extra cars if you really want to have them (or the NBA flags that's for sure) but you don't have to constantly pay dlcs and updates to play the new modes or scenarios. You just pay for the visual customs. However, the new key box system, taken from other games like this, is not really good for us usual players, as we don't want to keep paying for keys all the time to get new items, this should be rethought in my opinion.  A game that keeps udating, surprising and making us enjoy ourselves to the maximum, that's Rocket League.

> put £20 on Steam account > Steam Sales start > friend wants me to buy Rocket League mightaswell.jpg > 3am > less than 2 hours in-game > going maybe like 9-19 against friend > he has 188 hours  11/5 would play until early in the morning again     Seriously though.  As of writing this, I've owned Rocket League for... Maybe two... Three full days. I have 3.5 hours in it. I've done two sessions, both being 1v1 against a friend. Before I got this game, I was highly skeptical. I don't like football/soccer, never have, never will. Cars are cool, but I'm not a fan of driving games.  But somehow, I enjoy this. I really enjoy this.  And I hate that I enjoy this.   It's fun, both as a serious game and as a little timewaster. It's fun if you don't enjoy football. It's fun if you don't enjoy driving games. It's fun if you don't like sport. It's fun. It's just really fun.  There is a... Nitpicky issue, perhaps?  It struggles to run on my Mac. Yeah, I know, owning a Mac is a sin blah blah blah-- Whatever. My point is, my graphics settings are all Performance/High Performance, and I always get huge lag spikes, especially at the start of the game. It's playable, sure, but I'd rather not see everything in Minecraft mode, y'know? I'm sure the cars look real nice and all, but when I can't tell the colour of my opponent from the colour of the walls - both because I'm partially colourblind, and because of the graphics - that can be quite a problem.   Besides that, it's good. Really good. Worth the £15. And it's on sale. Definitely worth it.

Trust me when I say this: this game is beyond anything you ever imagined.  Prior to purchasing Rocket League, I thought that this was something that you would play for a couple of hours before getting tired of it and then leaving it for months. How fun can it really be to play soccer with rocket-powered battle-cars?  Well, I must say that it is very much fun. The mission is simple: you control a car, either alone or with teammates. You maneuver the car in any way you would like, in order to ultimately push the ball inside the opponent's goal. The whole stadium is at your disposal. Climb the walls to hit the ball in a difficult-to-read angle, use your rocket engine in order to aim for the sky and beat your opponent to the ball.  The mission is simple. But yet so complex. This is not a game that you will get the hang of within the first minutes. It will take some practice, and even after you feel like the basics are in place, there are a lot of room for improving. The skill gap is huge, which allows for all types of players to have fun, both casual and competitive.  Give Rocket League a try and you will not regret.

Fantastic Game.  - The devs are awesome, they interact with the community and listen to feedback and advice, They release new content which is free to play after the initial purchase (examples being the hoops, hockey, and rumble game-modes) which is a refreshing change from the money hungry companies. There is other DLC you can pay for to support Psyonix but it's not a pay to win type DLC scenario.   - Very chilled, the community is one of the best I've ever experienced in online gaming. Had a bad day at the office? Come home and play some Rocket League to relax. Getting battered by EAids on FIFA? Play some Rocket League to remember why you play games, for enjoyment. Not playing well? It's alright, most teammates will be very understanding and there are quite a few who will offer you tips on how to improve!  - You don't have to be good to enjoy it. I've played almost 50 hours on this wonderful piece of art and must admit I'm still pretty bad. I can't aerial to save my life and am an awful goalie. But I still thoroughly enjoy playing this game as it's a childhood dream come true to drive really fast cars and play football at the same time.  All in all Rocket League is an absolutely incredible game of which I highly, highly recommend.

Rocket League is an incredibly addicting game. The use of physics in the game is what makes every game you play so much different from the last which constantly keeps your interest. After every game you always find yourself thinking just one more because you're on a winning streak or to try and break a bad strings of games you've just played. The creativity in the different game modes and maps are also quite appealing as well as a feature to set up your own crazy game however you please. This game is not only incredibly fun for the casual gamer but also for more serious players with how much depth there is into tactics, timing, positioning, accuracy and skill. It is a very rewarding game for those who practice hard too. Also I love that the developers are always releasing the extra game modes or new maps for free which is a huge plus and doesn't split player base or leave casual players behind if they thought that maps/game modes as paid DLC were not worth their money and time.

There once was a little car who liked to play soccer with his friends. But one day, while they were playing, his friends got brutally murdered. Our little car just barely made it out alive.  And for a long time, this made him feel sad and depressed. He didn't want to go outside anymore, he didn't want to eat and nothing could make him happy... For months and months, he was just... moping around.  But one day, he decided his life couldn't go on like this. After all, his friends' murderers were still out there. Someone HAD to do something. So he got up, and started training and training... All day, every day... He knew that one day, he too, could become a Grandchampion in the Order of the Soccer Cars, and one day, he would avenge his fallen comrades!

Rocket league is one of the best games to come out in the last 10 years.  I can't lie, when Rocket League beat Undertale for game of the year I became an 8 year old who shipped fictional characters on the internet, I was salty. At that point I had never played RL and now that I've sunk in over 500 hours and over 1,000 games I can say it truly is game of the year.  On the surface level it appears as one of those games that's a fad, it would fade out over a year or two but after actually experiencing it I have high hopes for the future of this game.  Every game offers something new, the amount of time and effort you put into the game really reflects your performance.  Hats/Trails/Decals/Etc are really fun and offer you a way to personalize your experience.  The training really teaches you every thing from the basics to a low end competetive level of play (also I've noticed it is quite useful to practice in)  The free roam training is great, especially if you want to practice freestyles or work on your wall play.  Overall, Rocket League is honestly one of the best and most fun games I've played in a long time, sometimes the servers are an issue but those occurances are rare.  9.5/10

Rocket League is hands-down one of the best sports games of all time. It's so damn quirky, with such a strange concept, but dammit, I'd be lying if I didn't say this is one of the most addicting game's I've played!    PROS  -Great PC version. Runs great with plenty of options and inputs -So much content for the price. -Well-paced progression that involves some awesome goodies to unlock -It has microtransactions but everything is cosmetic. -Controls and plays like a dream -Gameplay itself is very deep, with many different ways to play and amazing stuff you can pull off -Perfect mix of casual and competitive play -Local Co-op is a big plus! -Graphically beautiful   NEUTRAL  -Soundtrack is alright, in my opinion. It's a bit too electronic for me but it's not anything unpleasant. --Community can be a**holes occasionally but are mostly pleasant, like any game community, really.   CONS  -No custom/community server browser. -Competitive (while very fun) isn't as fleshed out as it could be.    CONCLUSION    A must buy for anyone even remotely interested in any multiplayer games at all. Great fun for gamers of ALL ages, both casually and competitively.    Recommended for all gamers at full price.

If you're looking for a game that's quick and casual, but equally competitive and adrenaline-boosting in its style of gameplay, then Rocket League is definitely a game for you to add to your collection.  When first seeing Rocket League in the Top Seller charts, I at first thought that it was just a simple game involving race cars playing soccer. It figuratively didn't exactly sound entertaining in my mind. Then, after deciding to just buy it and try it out, I realized I was completely wrong and did not waste a single penny on the game.  Rocket League is jam-packed with competition and action. When you play a single match, you'll be so involved in the game that you might not even realize the amount of time that's passed when you play over 5 matches and 30 minutes of your free time just disappeared. The controls in Rocket League are extremely compatible with the human brain, so picking the game up and mastering it is possible for anybody, heroically lifting the heavy burden of people needing to be experienced racing gamers in order to have fun in Rocket League.  What's the greatest about Rocket League is the feeling it gives you when you play a match. When you try it out for the first time, you actually don't feel like an insignificant player who's just filling up another slot in a team-composition game. You feel focused, and you have motivation to try your best as well as practice to get even better. It's true that at first you feel that the ball is untouchable to you and that you can't really do anything besides punt it in the air when all the other players are stuck to each other like glue, but the game makes it entirely possible for anyone to skillfully rise from that level and eventually become a flying superstar that backflips 20 feet in the air in order to score a goal. What's the best about this game is how it frustrates the player; rather than making the player yell out of pure anger, which eventually boils into hatred for the game itself, Rocket League makes players feel frustration that rather motivates them to learn from their mistakes and think about how they can do better. The feeling of failure as well as the fear of it is not a drawback of this game at all, which is what makes this game such a successful product for casual and competitive players alike. No matter what, you won't exit Rocket League feeling worse than you did before you opened it.  The only drawback in the game, however, is its matchup system. While the game itself has a quick matchmaking system that hardly ever tries the player's patience, it can be a little rough for those who are playing for the first time. Sometimes, a new player will be matched against other gamers who have accumulated skill that flies into a league completely out of the newbie's reach, which as a result turns the game into a full-fledged 2v2 with the two remaining players struggling to just keep up with the ball. The new players can learn from the pros in this sense and raise their skill cap substantially, as well as witness the endless potential Rocket League has in store when they see sick plays and jumps made by the more experienced players, but it doesn't nullify the fact that not everyone has equal grounding on the playing field. Eventually, though, the playing field does gradually beome leveled, and when the newbie who jumps for no reason turns into a champion who can barrel roll into a flying ball at a different trajectory and score a goal, the feeling of achievement in accomplishing such a feat is just amazing.  Rocket League is suited as one of the best casual multiplayer-sport-arcade games you can have on your Steam account, and I expect that it will stay that way for a long time. But, that's just my opinion. What would be yours?

If you're looking for a game that's quick and casual, but equally competitive and adrenaline-boosting in its style of gameplay, then Rocket League is definitely a game for you to add to your collection.  When first seeing Rocket League in the Top Seller charts, I at first thought that it was just a simple game involving race cars playing soccer. It figuratively didn't exactly sound entertaining in my mind. Then, after deciding to just buy it and try it out, I realized I was completely wrong and did not waste a single penny on the game.  Rocket League is jam-packed with competition and action. When you play a single match, you'll be so involved in the game that you might not even realize the amount of time that's passed when you play over 5 matches and 30 minutes of your free time just disappeared. The controls in Rocket League are extremely compatible with the human brain, so picking the game up and mastering it is possible for anybody, heroically lifting the heavy burden of people needing to be experienced racing gamers in order to have fun in Rocket League.  What's the greatest about Rocket League is the feeling it gives you when you play a match. When you try it out for the first time, you actually don't feel like an insignificant player who's just filling up another slot in a team-composition game. You feel focused, and you have motivation to try your best as well as practice to get even better. It's true that at first you feel that the ball is untouchable to you and that you can't really do anything besides punt it in the air when all the other players are stuck to each other like glue, but the game makes it entirely possible for anyone to skillfully rise from that level and eventually become a flying superstar that backflips 20 feet in the air in order to score a goal. What's the best about this game is how it frustrates the player; rather than making the player yell out of pure anger, which eventually boils into hatred for the game itself, Rocket League makes players feel frustration that rather motivates them to learn from their mistakes and think about how they can do better. The feeling of failure as well as the fear of it is not a drawback of this game at all, which is what makes this game such a successful product for casual and competitive players alike. No matter what, you won't exit Rocket League feeling worse than you did before you opened it.  The only drawback in the game, however, is its matchup system. While the game itself has a quick matchmaking system that hardly ever tries the player's patience, it can be a little rough for those who are playing for the first time. Sometimes, a new player will be matched against other gamers who have accumulated skill that flies into a league completely out of the newbie's reach, which as a result turns the game into a full-fledged 2v2 with the two remaining players struggling to just keep up with the ball. The new players can learn from the pros in this sense and raise their skill cap substantially, as well as witness the endless potential Rocket League has in store when they see sick plays and jumps made by the more experienced players, but it doesn't nullify the fact that not everyone has equal grounding on the playing field. Eventually, though, the playing field does gradually beome leveled, and when the newbie who jumps for no reason turns into a champion who can barrel roll into a flying ball at a different trajectory and score a goal, the feeling of achievement in accomplishing such a feat is just amazing.  Rocket League is suited as one of the best casual multiplayer-sport-arcade games you can have on your Steam account, and I expect that it will stay that way for a long time. But, that's just my opinion. What would be yours?

Well at the beginning i did have some sort of worries about this game until i've played few matches, this game is a solid piece of work from Psyonix , and its worth 14,99$. The graphic's are awesome, but this game doesn't have the best optimalisation so you need at least a medium-class PC to run it on medium settings so the game looks decent. ( lucky me i was able to play it on ultra settings ) Just to make my review easier for you to read it, I've bullet-pointed some pros + cons.  Pros: - The game is fun. - Soundtrack is amazing. - Something new, it's like fifa combined with racing games. - The game gives you the option to choose on what continent the server you want to play on will be located, so if you live in UK you can choose to only play on servers located near West. - Great game to play with your friend's. - Allow you to play with keyboard / controller.  Cons: - The game require you to have a middle-class PC in order to play. - Very few arena's meaning your most likely to play most of you matches on same arenas which is boring. - 1 Ball, no other balls every single match uses same ball which is just gray and white... - Cases, is this ♥♥♥♥ing cs:go or league of legends ? why bring cases to a goddamit football game.....  OVERALL SCORE 7/10  Great gameplay, however require some time in order to be perfect.

This game is one of the best games that has been released in the last couple of years imo. If you play a lot of games with friends, you will be missing out of some good fun. It is absolutely worth the money, and Psyonix really did a great job on the 'sequel' of SSARBC. Only the matchmaking could be better, my level is Expert and my rank is Challenger Elite, but i get matched up against legends or sometimes even rocketeers, which is a bit unfair. But despite the matchmaking, great game.

Pros: - Takes absolutely no grinding, just pick up and play. - Games are short, so even blowouts don't get aggravating. - Matches are action-packed and it feels like you can contribute right away. - Easy to play, but has a high skill ceiling. - Tricks highly skilled players can pull off are more impressive than feeling cheap. - Community isn't salty, in-game folks tend to stay silent. - Cross-platform play means I can go against friends on XBone or PS4. - Uniquely suitable for players of all ages.  Cons: - Hoops and Hockey modes aren't as developed. - Not a big fan of the DLC and 'key' mechanics, prefer everything to be available through normal gameplay.  I think the best praise I can give Rocket League is that it's a game I come back to again and again because literally every match I've ever played has been fun. Jump in and jump out for a quick game, or play several in a row for a good night with friends. Excellent game for streaming, especially with friends in voice chat. Highly recommended.

Friends of mine and I bought the 4-Pack version of this game, so that we could all play together. This game is absolutely brilliant, and it quivkly replaced games like Left 4 Dead 2 and Dirt 3 for some simple multiplayer games between us.   The soundtrack is amazing, and fits the game well. The graphics are not very demanding, but still very pleasing.  Generally a great video game.  HOWEVER  Out of what is a 19,99€ game, I expected no microstransactions. Sure, they are only for cosmetic things, and sure, they don't affect the gameplay. But I still find it a hit under the belt to pay a 10nth of the price of the entire full game for a nicely rendered model of a DeLorean.  Also, do yourself a service, and get a controller to play this game. It is playable without, but playing with a controller is much more enjoyable.

Madly addicting, a ton of fun. If you enjoy games that can get your heart racing from the tension and competitiveness of it, then absolutely try Rocket League. I've played a lot of games over the last couple of years, but I've always come back to this one every time.  It's one of those games where the rules are incredibly simple - Get the ball in the net - but the mechanics and skill cieling are basically infinite in possibilities. The strategies, techniiques and ability you can develop can go on pretty much forever. You'll spend some time just working out how to reliably hit the ball, but as your skill grows, and you become more and more comfortable with your control, you'll find yourself spending hours on end without even realising.  Pretty much the epitome of 'Just one more game...'

Game can become repetitive if played repeatedly.

I normally play games on console since that what friends play, but Rocket League got me hooked and is the game I play by far the most now. I originally got it free on PS4 (which is what made me buy it on Steam), then I also bought it on Xbox One to play with friends on xbox. I have never owned 3 different versions of the same game in my life until now, but I don't regret it at all.  I do wish that the PC version had an exclusive car like the Xbox or PS4, but it's not like it will keep me from playing. It was also a bit worrisome when Rocket League introduced a loot crate system, but Psyonix has handled it fairly well so that a player does not gain any sort of advantage by spending money on crates/keys. All upgrades gained from the crates are purely cosmetic, and one does not have to pay extra to stay competitive.  Overall, there are a few bugs that pop up (I've never experienced anything close to game-breaking) but they normally get patched fairly quickly as Psyonix seems to listen (at least some) to their fans. The game gets regular updates, which are generally good. This is an exceptionally good game with new features being added regularly at no extra cost, which is completely worth the full price. However, it does go on sale for about $12 quite often and should be bought immdiately at that price if you are at all interested in the game.  So far, I have only encountered people who love Rocket League and people who have not played Rocket League.

There are so many reviews for this game, that my words may not matter in relation to the sheer amount of other people that have probably commented on this game. With that in mind, I'll keep my review as short, yet succinct as possible.   Rocket League is by far the most difficult game in terms of mechanics I've ever had the privilege to play. Even thought I'm close to 1000 hours in the game, it has become abundantly clear over time that I'm not meant to be a great player. I have made it as far as the third blue rank (what the hell is the name of it again?) in 2's. I have bounced back and forth between the mouse and keyboard and the controller. It's clear the controller is the superior option for playing the game, but I prefer the feel of m&k.   At first, you're to be terrible. I can remember a time when I was the lowest of the low in the game. I couldn't hit anything, I didn't understand how to fly in the air, and boost was a nonexistent part of the game. However, Rocket League is one of those games where you keep playing, practicing, and learning, and eventually you'll find you've grown in rank and skill. I'm one of the few players that will invest another thousand hours into the game, but I'm afraid I've reached my peak. Even though I still enjoy the game, unlike others, a thousand hours have taught me so much but there is even more to learn.  I'll be honest, don't pick up this game expecting to be an amazing player. In fact, you'll probably spend more time in the lower elo's than in other games with a similar ranking system. But don't let it deter you. If you want to be good, you'll eventually be great.  On a side note, Psyonix is one of the few companies that truly cares about its players. They are very active on their forums and Reddit, and truly do seem like the kind of company that listens and responds to the best of their ability.   tl;dr  Game is hard. Very hard. But time, practice, patience, and a little persistence eventually leads to a skill based kind of fun.
